name: Aesthir Glider
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
Aesthir Glider can’t block.
flavor:
“We recovered this device from a thawing glacier high in the mountains—a fine example of the rich rewards of artifice.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Ashnod's Cylix
rules: {Tn}: Target player looks at the top three cards of their library, puts one of them back on top of their library, then exiles the rest.
flavor:
“Few remember that Ashnod’s defilement of Terisiare’s resources outstripped even that of her peers—a true inspiration.”
—General Varchild, Betrayer of Kjeldor

name: Astrolabe
rules: {1s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice: Add two mana of any one color. If snow mana was spent to activate this ability, you may scry 1, then draw a card.
flavor:
“Apparently this ancient instrument is used for observing the night sky and showing the positions of the stars.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Floodwater Dam
rules: {Xs}, {Tn}: Tap X target lands. They don’t untap during their controller’s next untap step.
flavor:
“You might as well try and dam the Yavimaya River with wooden toothpicks. Nature’s a lot more stubborn than any fool thinking they can hold back the Thaw.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Gustha's Scepter
rules:
{Tn}: Exile a card from your hand face down. You may still look at it.
{Tn}: You may play a card exiled with Gustha’s Scepter this turn.
When you lose control of Gustha’s Scepter, put all cards exiled with it into their owner’s graveyard.

name: Helm of Obedience
rules: {Xs}, {Tn}: Target player mills X cards. If one or more creature cards were put into the graveyard this way, sacrifice Helm of Obedience and put one of them into play under your control. X can’t be 0.
flavor: “You know, if you kiss me while I’m wearing this, I can’t promise I won’t obey absolutely everything you wish for.”

name: Lodestone Bauble
rules: {1s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Lodestone Bauble: Choose up to five cards from all graveyards. Put them on top of their owners’ libraries in any order. Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor: The lodestones are not inert relics of the past. Their strange magnetism stirs when struck by the sharp kiss of cold lightning.

name: Mishra's Groundbreaker
rules:
{Tn}, Sacrifice Mishra’s Groundbreaker:
Choose one —
• Target land becomes a 6/6 artifact creature that’s still a land.
• Destroy up to three nonbasic lands.
flavor: The earth remembers Mishra’s command.

name: Mystic Compass
rules:
{Tn}: Target land becomes a basic snow or nonsnow land type of your choice until end of turn.
{2s}, {Tn}: Untap all lands you control.
flavor:
“You say north is that way? And I say north is where I want it to be!”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Phyrexian Devourer
rules:
Phyrexian Devourer gains trample and hexproof if its power is 10+. When its power is 15 or greater, sacrifice it.
Exile or mill the top card of your library: Put X +1/+1 counters on Phyrexian Devourer, where X is the exiled/milled card’s mana value.
flavor: One, four, seven, twelve, BOOM!

name: Phyrexian Portal
rules: {0s}: If your library has ten or more cards in it, target opponent looks at the top ten cards and separates them into two face-down piles. Exile one pile. Search the other pile for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle the rest of that pile into your library.
flavor: Which vein is least tainted by impurity?

name: Phyrexian War Beast
rules: When Phyrexian War Beast leaves play, draw a card, sacrifice a land, and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.
flavor:
“Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Scarab of the Unseen
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice Scarab of the Unseen: Return all Auras in play to their owners’ hands. Draw a card for each Aura returned to your hand this way.
flavor:
“Has anyone seen my robe? Oh, right, I completely forgot this damned necklace makes all apparel invisible, nevermind.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Scarab of the Unseen
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice Scarab of the Unseen: Return all Auras in play to their owners’ hands. Draw a card for each Aura returned to your hand this way.
flavor:
“You seem distracted, dear. Is the necklace’s magic so fascinating? Or is it simply the irresistible vision it reveals?”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Shield Sphere
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`
Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor:
“My soldiers march secure knowing that no peril can breach the shield I have placed between them and harm’s way.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Sol Grail
rules:
As Sol Grail enters play, choose a color.
{Tn}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
{Ss}: Add two mana of the chosen color.
{1s}, {Tn}: Choose a different color.
flavor:
“Surrender your sight to the Grail’s liquid depths, and see there what you desire most.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Soldevi Digger
rules:
{1s}: Put the top card of your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
{1s}: Put the bottom card of your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor:
“This ceaseless device has helped uncover marvels unreachable by mere flesh.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Soldevi Sentry
rules:
{1s}: Soldevi Sentry gains indestructible until end of turn.
{1s}: Soldevi Sentry gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor:
“Say hello to our newfound security.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Soldevi Steam Beast
rules:
Whenever Soldevi Steam Beast becomes tapped, target opponent gains 1 life.
{1s}: Soldevi Steam Beast gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
“Dagsson saw the steam as life giving— until he felt its scalding touch as his beloved machines betrayed him and Soldev.”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Storm Cauldron
rules:
Each player may play an additional land during each of their turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner’s hand.
{Tn}, Sacrifice Storm Cauldron: All players discard all lands.
flavor: All land shall heed the Thaw’s command.

name: Urza's Engine
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
{1s}: Redirect any amount of damage from target creature you control to Urza’s Engine or vice versa.
flavor:
“Man and machine, perfected as one.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Whirling Catapult
rules: {2s}, Exile the top three cards of your library: Whirling Catapult deals 3 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
flavor:
“Direct confrontation never was to the Orcs’ taste, especially when it tasted like bitter, scorched metal junk.”
—General Varchild, Betrayer of Kjeldor

name: Balduvian Dead
rules: {1s}{Rs}: Return a creature card from your graveyard into play under your control with a +1/+1 counter on it. The creature is black and red in addition to its original colors. It gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the next end step.
flavor: Many heroes of Balduvia became echoes in thunder and frost after their death.

name: Casting of Bones
rules:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, draw three cards, then discard one of them.
flavor:
“Whether whole or not, still we serve Lim-Dûl’s wishes, our fates entwined with his will until the end of days.”
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Contagion
rules:
You may pay 1 life and exile a black card from your hand rather than pay Contagion’s mana cost.
Distribute three -1/-1 counters among any number of target creatures.
flavor: Yet another town falls prey to the might of the awesome Eyebeams Cat...

name: Diseased Vermin
rules:
Whenever Diseased Vermin deals combat damage to a player, they get a poison counter.
During your upkeep, Diseased Vermin deals X damage to target opponent that it has previously dealt damage to, where X is the number of poison counters they have.

name: Dystopia
rules:
During your upkeep, pay 1 life or sacrifice Dystopia. If you pay, put a snow counter on Dystopia.
During each player’s upkeep, that player discards a card unless they control no green, white, or blue permanents.
Remove a snow counter: Target player sacrifices a permanent or discards a card.

name: Fatal Lore
rules:
Target opponent chooses one —
• You draw four cards.
• That opponent exiles two target creatures they control.
flavor:
“All knowledge has its price—and the debt is paid in silence and shadow.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Feast or Famine
rules:
Choose one —
• This spell becomes a 4/4 black Zombie creature with haste. Sacrifice it at the next end step.
• Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. If it has indestructible, it loses that ability until end of turn.

name: Fevered Strength
rules:
Target creature gets +6/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“The fever clouds the mind as it energizes the body. Both will pass in time.”
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Insidious Bookworms
rules: When Insidious Bookworms dies, you may pay {1s}{Bs}. If you do, target player discards a card at random. If you control a snow land, they discard two cards instead.
flavor: Knowledge is a voracious hunger—feed it well, or it will feed on you, ever hungry for the warmth of your mind.

name: Keeper of Tresserhorn
rules: Whenever Keeper of Tresserhorn attacks and isn’t blocked, it assigns no combat damage this turn and defending player loses 3 life.
flavor: In his absence, Lim-Dûl entrusts mighty avatars with the mantle of authority over Tresserhorn as his rightful proxies.

name: Krovikan Horror
rules:
At the end step, if Krovikan Horror is in your graveyard, you may return it to your hand.
Sacrifice a creature: Krovikan Horror deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor: A relentless nightmare that offers no respite from its tormenting grasp.

name: Krovikan Plague
rules:
Enchant creature you control
When Krovikan Plague enters play, draw a card at the next end step.
Tap enchanted creature: Krovikan Plague deals 3 damage to any target. Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.

name: Lim-Dul's High Guard
rules:
{FirstStrike}`First strike`
{1s}{Bs}: Lim-Dûl’s High Guard gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
“Death does not prevent us from service to our absent master. As long as the tower of Tresserhorn stands, so shall we.”
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Misinformation
rules:
Put up to four target cards from target player’s graveyard either on top or on the bottom of their library in any order.
Cycling {Ss}
flavor:
“When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. And when you cannot trust those, follow your instincts.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Phantasmal Fiend
rules:
{1s}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{Bs}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend’s power and toughness until end of turn.
flavor:
“Don’t trust your eyes in the drifting snow. Things vanish before you can see them.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Phyrexian Boon
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it’s black. Otherwise, it gets -1/-2.
flavor:
“Phyrexia’s touch is a cruel blessing that strengthens those who embrace the darkness and withers those who do not.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Ritual of the Machine
rules: Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
flavor:
“Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson and his merry band of excavators heed the danger therein?”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Soldevi Adnate
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice a black or artifact creature: Add an amount of {Bs} equal to the sacrificed creature’s mana value.
flavor:
“People love to follow fools—they don’t feel so alone then. Fear binds us tighter than any creed, and comfort is easily found in the shadow of a confident mistake.”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Stench of Decay
rules: Nonartifact creatures get -3/-2 until end of turn.
flavor:
“My beloved Disa is dead, and I am left all alone here. I must do everything in my power not to allow others to succumb to this wretched pestilence.”
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid

name: Stromgald Spy
rules:
{DoubleStrike}`Double strike`  {Shadow3}`Shadow`
Whenever Stromgald Spy attacks and isn’t blocked, you may have defending player play with their hand revealed for as long as this card remains in play.
flavor: In the shadows, she weaves through danger with grace and purpose.

name: Swamp Mosquito
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Shadow3}`Shadow`
Whenever this creature attacks and isn’t blocked, defending player gets two poison counters.
flavor: The swamp’s murky depths cradle this harbinger of venomous fate, whose allure is rivaled only by its lethal kiss.

name: Bounty of the Hunt
rules:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay Bounty of the Hunt’s mana cost.
Distribute eight +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures. Remove these counters at the next end step.
flavor: The bounty lies not just in the kill, but in the thrill of survival among unseen hunters.

name: Deadly Insect
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Shroud}`Shroud`  {Infect}`Infect`
When this creature attacks or blocks, roll a six-sided die to set its power.
flavor:
“Beautiful, indeed—but one sting could fell a Giant in a heartbeat.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Elvish Bard
rules:
All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.
Elvish Bard gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor: Drawn irresistibly close, foes and friends alike, eventually realize the bard’s tune hides more than mere harmony.

name: Elvish Ranger
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`
{Gs}, {Tn}: Target creature can’t attack or block this turn.
{1s}: Add {Gs}.
flavor:
“A fragile hand can still strike the fatal blow against the proudest of warriors.”
—Kaysa, Elvish Elder Druid

name: Elvish Ranger
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`
{Gs}, {Tn}: Target creature can’t attack or block this turn.
{1s}: Add {Gs}.
flavor:
“Every warrior melts beneath a gentle touch—as intoxicating as it is lethal.”
—Kaysa, Elvish Elder Druid

name: Elvish Spirit Guide
rules: Exile Elvish Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {Gs}.
flavor:
“To speak with the spirits, one must shed all distractions and fabric and feel earth’s skin on their own, with senses attuned.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Fyndhorn Druid
rules: When Fyndhorn Druid dies, you gain 3 life. If it was blocked this turn, you gain 6 life instead.
flavor:
“All struggles ultimately require sacrifice, some are just dearer than others.”
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Advocate

name: Gargantuan Gorilla
rules:
During your upkeep, you may sacrifice a land. If you sacrifice a snow land this way, Gargantuan Gorilla gains trample until end of turn. If you don’t sacrifice a land, sacrifice Gargantuan Gorilla.
{Tn}: Gargantuan Gorilla fights target creature.

name: Gift of the Woods
rules:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+3 until end of turn and you gain 2 life.
Enchanted creature gains hexproof for as long as you control a snow land.
flavor: Clad in leaf alone, she moves unseen.

name: Gorilla Berserkers
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
Gorilla Berserkers can’t be blocked except by three or more creatures.
Whenever Gorilla Berserkers becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor: A thousand roars in one charge.

name: Gorilla Chieftain
rules: {1s}{Gs}: Gorilla Chieftain gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
“You again? Back for more trouble, huh? Was hoping for a quiet day, but I guess not. Of all the nuisances in this jungle, you’re by far the most persistent.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Hail Storm
rules: Hail Storm deals 3 damage to each attacking creature and 2 damage to every other target.
flavor:
“If they can’t take the hail, they’d better stay home. Out here, the storm decides who survives—and it’s never kind.”
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Kaysa, Elder Druid
rules: Green creatures you control get +2/+2.
flavor: “We are but threads in the great tapestry of life, woven together by our shared existence. To walk in harmony with nature is to understand that we are not separate from it.”
lore: Kaysa was raised in Mikkel as Halvor Arenson’s ward, serving in the town church until Kolbjörn recognized the crescent Mark and took her in with Disa. Forged by the Juniper Order, she aided Freyalise in casting the World Spell and became an Elder Druid as the Ice Age broke. When the Thaw brought rising seas and panic, she helped lead survivors—binding people together as surely as she bound the wild.
art: Her allure is grounded strength—softness without fragility, authority without armor—set against a landscape that punishes hesitation. The pale light in the sky feels like the crescent Mark’s calling, subtle but undeniable. Even in winter, she looks like someone spring would obey.

name: Nature's Chosen
rules:
Enchant creature you control
{0s}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate only during your turn and only once each turn.
Enchanted creature gains “{Tn}: Untap target artifact, creature, or land. Activate only once each turn.”

name: Nature's Wrath
rules:
Whenever a player puts an Island, Swamp, Mountain, or a blue, black, or red permanent into play, they sacrifice a nonsnow land or a nonsnow permanent of the same kind.
{Tn}: Untap target snow land or artifact you control or tap target nonsnow land or artifact you don’t control.

name: Splintering Wind
rules:
{1s}{Gs}: Splintering Wind deals 1 damage to any target. If a creature damaged this way has flying, it loses that ability.
When Splintering Wind leaves play, it deals 1 damage to every target.
flavor:
“Yavimaya has a subtle way of politely asking the intruders to leave her forests.”
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of Juniper Order

name: Taste of Paradise
flavor:
“Any who drink of Freyalise’s bounty drink the mead of rebirth.”
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of Juniper Order

name: Taste of Paradise
flavor:
“Freyalise’s nectar offers rebirth in every sip, honeyed warmth lighting your very core.”
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of Juniper Order

name: Tornado
rules:
During your upkeep, sacrifice Tornado unless you pay 1 life for each velocity counter on it.
{1s}{Gs}, {Tn}: Destroy target permanent and put a velocity counter on Tornado.
flavor: Everything standing in its path better be prepared for a journey into oblivion.

name: Undergrowth
rules:
Kicker {Rs}
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. If Undergrowth was kicked, it doesn’t prevent combat damage dealt by red or green creatures.
flavor:
“The true art of survival is knowing how to turn obstacles into your advantage.”
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Advocate

name: Whip Vine
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`  {Reach}`Reach`
You may choose not to untap Whip Vine during your untap step.
{Tn}: Tap target creature with flying blocked by Whip Vine. That creature doesn’t untap during its controller’s untap step for as long as Whip Vine remains tapped.

name: Yavimaya Ancients
rules: {Gs}: Yavimaya Ancients gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
flavor:
“The Ancients teach us that patience is the quiet strength of the forest, for those who wait with steady heart will see the dawn after the darkest night.”
—Kaysa, Elvish Elder Druid

name: Yavimaya Ants
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`  {Haste}`Haste`
During your upkeep, sacrifice Yavimaya Ants unless you pay {Gs}.
flavor:
“The tiniest creatures, united by hunger, become a force that shatters forests and silences the earth beneath their march.”
—Kaysa, Elvish Elder Druid

name: Energy Arc
rules:
Untap any number of target creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to them and by them this turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“Relent, and you’ll transcend your trials.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Lim-Dul's Paladin
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
During your upkeep, you may sacrifice this creature. If you do, draw a card.
Whenever Lim-Dûl’s Paladin attacks and isn’t blocked, defending player loses 4 life. Whenever it becomes blocked, it gets +6/+3 until end of turn.

name: Lim-Dul's Vault
rules: Look at the top five cards of your library. As many times as you like, you may pay 1 life, put those cards on the bottom of your library in any order, then look at the top five cards of your library. Then shuffle your library and put the last cards you looked at this way on top of it in any order.

name: Lord of Tresserhorn
rules:
When Lord of Tresserhorn enters play, you lose 2 life, you sacrifice two creatures, and target opponent draws two cards.
{Bs}: Lord of Tresserhorn gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: He was built through necromancy from the flesh and bone of Kjeldoran heroes.
lore: When Leshrac tore Lim-Dûl from Tresserhorn and carried him away to Shandalar, the keep’s dead did what dead always do without a master: they started thinking for themselves. Chaeska couldn’t allow that—not with Tresserhorn’s armies poised to turn inward and tear their own stronghold apart. So he stitched a new lord from stolen greatness: the flesh and bone of a dozen Kjeldoran heroes, hammered into obedience and crowned in rust. It never slept, only recited its borrowed victories like prayers to a vanished tyrant—until Jodah and Jaya returned, and the false lord met a true mage’s reprisal.
art: The Lord stands like a bad idea that learned to walk—candlelight’s nightmare made real: blades jutting from its helm, a face assembled in crude homage to Lim-Dûl, and hands that look made for both slaughter and ceremony. The ragged mantle and brutal axe read like a throne in motion, ruling by presence alone. Its glowing eyes promise the keep’s true law: obedience or bone.

name: Misfortune
rules:
An opponent chooses one —
• You put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and gain 8 life.
• That opponent puts a -1/-1 counter on each creature they control and Misfortune deals 8 damage to them.
flavor: Well, today simply isn’t your lucky day.

name: Nature's Blessing
rules: {Gs}, or {Ws}, or discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or that creature gains flying, first strike, or trample permanently.
flavor:
“To stand unveiled beneath sun and stream is to know every blessing—treasure each as nature’s silent hymn of renewal.”
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of Juniper Order

name: Nature's Blessing
rules: {Gs}, or {Ws}, or discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or that creature gains flying, first strike, or trample permanently.
flavor:
“Unveiled in nature’s arms, every curve lit in sunlight, every sigh answered by river’s gentle song—all the world a lover’s hymn.”
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of Juniper Order

name: Phelddagrif the Paragon
rules:
{Gs}: Phelddagrif gains trample until end of turn. Distribute two +1/+1 counters among any target creatures.
{Ws}: Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. You gain 3 life.
{Us}: Return Phelddagrif to its owner’s hand. Draw two cards.
flavor: It tramples like a joke, flies like a rumor, and vanishes the moment you try to be certain.
lore: In the last bitter stretches of the Ice Age, travelers spoke of a single phelddagrif roaming Terisiare—an impossible, winged behemoth that answered panic with generosity. It would bolster the weary, lift the trapped from snowbound gullies, and then slip away as if reality itself had simply blinked.
art: A massive purple-gray hippo-beast surges through shallow water, wings flared wide, spray and light bursting behind it like a thaw breaking loose. Its expression is half-feral, half-mirthful—dangerous, yet oddly comforting.

name: Surge of Strength
rules: Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that creature’s mana value plus 1.
flavor:
“Even dragons rise highest against the wind—not with it. Winds may buffet and batter, but it is their resistance that crafts the legends of the air.”
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Wandering Mage
rules:
{Flash}`Flash`
{Ws}: Prevent the next 2 damage dealt to any target this turn. You gain 2 life.
{Us}: Prevent the next 4 damage dealt to target white or blue creature this turn.
{Bs}: Distribute two -1/-1 counters among any target creatures.

name: Winter's Night
rules:
Whenever you tap a snow land for mana, add one additional mana of any type that land produced.
{3s}: Target land becomes snow.
flavor:
“The Thaw teaches us to forget ourselves just as melted snow forgets its life.”
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of Juniper Order

name: Balduvian Trading Post
rules:
When Balduvian Trading Post enters play, sacrifice an untapped Mountain. If you don’t, put Balduvian Trading Post into its owner’s graveyard.
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Rs}.
{Tn}: Balduvian Trading Post deals 2 damage to any target.

name: Heart of Yavimaya
rules:
When Heart of Yavimaya enters play, sacrifice a Forest. If you don’t, put Heart of Yavimaya into its owner’s graveyard.
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Gs}.
{Tn}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Kjeldoran Outpost
rules:
When this land enters play, sacrifice a Plains. If you don’t, put Kjeldoran Outpost into its owner’s graveyard.
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Ws}.
{Tn}: Roll two color dice. Creatures you control gain hexproof from the rolled colors until end of turn.

name: Lake of the Dead
rules:
When this land enters play, sacrifice a Swamp. If you don’t, put Lake of the Dead into its owner’s graveyard.
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Bs}.
{Tn}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Add four {Bs}.
flavor: The still waters of this dark lake reflect a silent world where life is but an illusion.

name: School of the Unseen
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Cs}.
{2s}, {Tn}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor:
“When the ice descended, this fortress woven from the arcane mist cloaked itself in magic’s silent embrace, hiding from eyes unworthy to witness its secrets.”
—Jodah, Archmage Eternal

name: Sheltered Valley of Elbreth
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Cs}.
During your upkeep, if you control four lands or less, you gain 4 life, otherwise you gain 1 life.
flavor: Deep in the Karplusan Mountains lies a valley that has oddly been spared from the grip of ice and the floods of the Thaw.
lore: Elbreth clings to the Karplusan heights, and below it a valley hides like a held breath—green, warm, and wrong. The locals swear it’s “sheltered,” but their prayers sound more like rules, spoken carefully so the valley doesn’t remember it can be found.
art: High cliffs cradle a quiet, sunlit valley while the outer slopes remain cold and severe. A small silhouette on the ridge emphasizes the unnatural safety below—beautiful, inviting, and faintly ominous, as if the land is patiently waiting for someone to step in.

name: Soldevi Excavations
rules:
When Soldevi Excavations enters play, sacrifice an untapped Island. If you don’t, put Soldevi Excavations into its owner’s graveyard.
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Us}.
{Tn}: Scry 2.
flavor: Relics may be old, but discoveries are new.

name: Thawing Glaciers
rules:
{Tn}: Search your library for a basic land card and put it into play tapped.
Return Thawing Glaciers to its owner’s hand at the next end step.
flavor: The melt of ice releases more than water— it shapes valleys, reveals ancient land, and reminds that time always finds a way.

name: Agent of Stromgald
rules:
{Rs}: Add {Bs}.
{Bs}: Agent of Stromgald gets +1/+1.
flavor:
“Varchild wears Kjeldoran armor but fights with the fury of a Balduvian—she is no friend to either, only to vengeance.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Balduvian Horde
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
When Balduvian Horde enters play, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
flavor:
“Peace will come when Varchild’s dead.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Balduvian War-Makers
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`  {Haste}`Haste`
Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor:
“Barbarians will cower before my steel!”
—General Varchild, Betrayer of Kjeldor

name: Bestial Fury
rules:
{Flash}`Flash`
Enchant creature
When Bestial Fury enters play, draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, it gets +6/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

name: Burnout
rules:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell. If that spell is blue, black, or green, exile it instead and Burnout deals 2 damage to that spell’s controller.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“GOTCHA! Didn’t even blink, did ya?”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Chaos Harlequin
rules: {Rs}: Exile the top card of your library. If that card is a land card, Chaos Harlequin gets -2/-0 until end of turn and you may untap a target land. Otherwise, put five +1/+1 counters on Chaos Harlequin.
flavor: When you’re a clown, nobody takes you seriously—until they get burned...

name: Death Spark
rules:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to any target.
During your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard, you may pay {1s}.{BL}If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.
flavor: Spark after spark, the end nears closer.

name: Enslaved Scout
rules:
{Mountainwalk}`Mountainwalk`  {Snowwalk}`Snow landwalk`
#Snow landfall —# Whenever a snow land enters play under your control, Enslaved Scout gains +1/+1 until end of turn.
{1s}: Target creature other than Enslaved Scout gains either mountainwalk or snowwalk until end of turn.

name: Gorilla Shaman
rules:
{Xs}{1s}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with mana value X.
Whenever you destroy an artifact with Gorilla Shaman, that artifact deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
“Quite frankly, the practice of destruction should best be left to us, professionals.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Gorilla War Cry
rules:
All creatures get +1/+0 and gain menace until end of turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“The only ‘art’ these beasts possess is the art of noise. How about some subtlety?”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Guerrilla Tactics
rules:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 3 damage to any target.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard or exile Guerrilla Tactics, it deals 4 damage to any target.
flavor: “Don’t open that barrel! It’s booby tra—”

name: Omen of Fire
rules: Destroy all nonbasic lands and snow lands. Omen of Fire deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor:
“Let Balduvia burn to warm Kjeldor’s hearth! When mountains blaze and steppes ignite, only the fierce survive.”
—General Varchild, Betrayer of Kjeldor

name: Pillage
rules: Destroy target artifact or land. If it has indestructible, exile it instead.
flavor:
“Were they to reduce us to ash, we would still prevail, for the very air they breathe would become our weapon, and their victory would taste of grit and defeat.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Primitive Justice
rules:
Multikicker {1s}{Rs} or {1s}{Gs}
Destroy target artifact. For each time Primitive Justice was kicked with {1s}{Rs}, destroy another target artifact. For each time it was kicked with {1s}{Gs}, destroy another target artifact, and you gain 2 life.

name: Pyrokinesis
rules:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis’s mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided among any number of target creatures.
flavor:
“Anybody want some... toast?”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Rogue Skycaptain
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Haste}`Haste`
During your upkeep, you may pay {1s}. {BL}If you don’t, an opponent gains control of Rogue Skycaptain.
flavor:
“King Darien may like to think differently, but masters of the sky serve no master.”
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Soldier of Fortune
rules:
{Rs}, {Tn}: Target player shuffles their library. If snow mana was spent to activate this ability, Soldier of Fortune deals 1 damage to any target.
When Soldier of Fortune dies, you may pay {1s}{Rs}. If you do, draw a card.
flavor: Loyalty to gold coins is still loyalty.

name: Storm Shaman
rules:
{Haste}`Haste`
{Rs}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“Let the lightning be your warning, and the thunder your unyielding battle cry.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Varchild's Crusader
rules: {1s}{Rs}{Xs}: Varchild’s Crusader and X red target creatures can’t be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild’s Crusader at the next end step.
flavor:
“We could have lasting peace by now, but Varchild would rather have the maps of the new Kjeldor drawn in Balduvian blood.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Varchild's War-Riders
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`  {Menace}`Menace`
During your upkeep, target opponent{BL2} may return a creature card from your graveyard to play under their control.
Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

name: Veteran's Voice
rules:
Enchant creature you control
Enchanted creature has “{Tn}: Target untapped creature gets +2/+1 until end of turn.”
When Veteran’s Voice is put into a graveyard from play, you may return it to play instead.

name: Arcane Denial
rules: Counter target spell. Its controller may draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep. You draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor: “Oh, come on, If I wished your spell to resolve, I’d brandish a banner—and charge a king’s ransom for the honor.”

name: Awesome Presence
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can’t be blocked unless defending player pays {3s} for each creature they control that’s blocking it.
flavor:
“I shape my weapons from the fears of my enemies, each strike a reminder that terror and dread wield powers of their own.”
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Benthic Explorers
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
{Tn}, Untap a tapped land an opponent controls: Add one mana of any type that land could produce.
flavor: “This coral reef looks so familiar. Do you think we’re lost, or just spectacularly directionally challenged again?”

name: Browse
rules: {1s}{Us}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, one at the bottom of your library, and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor:
“Is it literature, or litter? Oh, look, what’s an Orc doing in a library? Careful, big guy— those words bite harder than your axe.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Diminishing Returns
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library. You exile the top five cards of your library. For each snow permanent exiled this way, untap a permanent you control. Then each player draws up to five cards.
flavor: “Why waste magic on mere wonders, when you can rewrite reality entirely?”

name: False Demise
rules:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card into play under your control.
flavor:
“Far too many of our missing ‘dead’ seem to be turning up in Varchild’s ranks—still clad in our colors, but the spark is gone.”
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Force of Will
rules:
You may pay 1 life and exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Force of Will’s mana cost.
Counter target spell.
flavor:
“There are professionals and there are amateurs—and then there are people like me, who determine their own destiny.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Foresight
rules:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor: “Behind every choice lies a thousand shadows, but I see beyond, plucking certainty from chaos to guide my hand.”

name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
rules: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“All the knowledge of Lat-Nam could not prevent the Brothers’ War. The greatest minds undone by the tides of chaos.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Library of Lat-Nam
rules:
An opponent chooses one —
• You draw four cards during the next turn’s upkeep.
• You search your library for two cards, and put them into your hand.
flavor: The sacred halls still echo with secrets whispered by scholars long since gone.

name: Phantasmal Sphere
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
During your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Phantasmal Sphere.
flavor: The Sphere’s radiant light knows no moderation. With each turn it wagers everything until its brilliance adorns another’s endless, stormy sky.

name: Soldevi Heretic
rules: {Ws}, {Tn}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor:
“In the cold arms of tragedy, there is little comfort in being right—only the heavy burden of bitter, relentless truth and the silent weight of what might have been.”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Soldevi Sage
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.
flavor:
“Our secret underground archives grow daily, as our excavators and sages alike dig to uncover new hidden wonders.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Spiny Starfish
rules: {Us}: If Spiny Starfish died this turn, return it into play under your control and Spiny Starfish deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor:
“If I have learned anything from this resilient starfish, it’s this: the power to return is the fiercest weapon of all.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Storm Crow
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {Deathtouch} {Lifelink} {Indestructible}

name: Storm Elemental
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Us}, Exile the top card of your library: Tap target creature with flying.
{Us}, Exile the top card of your library: If the exiled card is snow, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Beware the whispers in the storm.

name: Suffocation
rules:
Suffocation deals 4 damage to the controller of the last instant or sorcery spell that dealt damage to you or a creature you control this turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor: Screaming for release without a sound.

name: Thought Lash
rules: Exile the top card of your library: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
flavor: She stands beneath the stormy skies, a conduit of fierce knowledge, every strike burning away what she once was to awaken what she must become.

name: Tidal Control
rules:
Pay 2 life or {1s}{Us}: Counter target red, green, or white spell. Any player may activate this ability.
At each end step, each opponent loses 1 life for each red, green, or white spell they cast this turn.
Whenever the counter ability is activated, its controller draws a card.

name: Viscerid Armor
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
{1s}{Us}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner’s hand.
flavor: Each scar etched into this battered shell tells a story of survival and sacrifice, binding past and present in chitin and spirit.

name: Viscerid Drone
rules:
{Tn}, Sacrifice a creature and a land: Destroy target nonartifact creature. If it has indestructible, exile it instead.
{Tn}, Sacrifice a creature and a snow land: Destroy target creature. If it has indestructible, it loses that ability until end of turn.

name: Carrier Pigeons
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
When Carrier Pigeons enters play, draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
When Carrier Pigeons dies, return it to your hand.
flavor:
“Birds know no borders! Why should we?”
—General Varchild

name: Errand of Duty
rules:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 and become Knights in addition to their other creature types.
{Ws}: Redirect any amount of combat damage dealt to a creature you control to target Knight.
flavor:
“Call every available hand to our side.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Exile
rules: Exile target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor:
“When you vanish into the Karplusan exile, the frozen gates close behind you with a hush that echoes louder than thunder and deeper than memory.”
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Advocate

name: Inheritance
rules: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1s}. If you do, draw a card.
flavor:
“More than lessons may be gained from the past and more than mere trinkets from our history. Within every keepsake lies a blueprint for tomorrow’s resolve.”
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Ivory Gargoyle
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
When Ivory Gargoyle dies in combat, return it to play under its owner’s control at the next end step.
{5s}{Ws}: Exile target creature and Ivory Gargoyle.
flavor: When memory fades, stone persists.

name: Juniper Order Advocate
rules: Green creatures you control get +2/+2.
flavor:
“We alone carry the hope of reconciliation, for where Elf and Human stand as one, the forest itself echoes the ancient vows.”
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Advocate

name: Kjeldoran Escort
rules:
{FirstStrike}`First strike`
{0s}: Redirect any amount of combat damage dealt to a creature you control to Kjeldoran Escort.
{Ws}, {Tn}: Target creature gains Protection from a color of your choice until end of turn.

name: Kjeldoran Home Guard
rules: At end of combat, if Kjeldoran Home Guard attacked or blocked this combat, put a -1/-1 counter on it and +1/+1 counter on target creature other than Kjeldoran Home Guard.
flavor: For far too many guards, the lure of the wild would prove too strong—the line between duty and freedom blurred.

name: Kjeldoran Pride
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
{Us}: Attach this aura to target creature other than enchanted creature.
flavor:
“Fighting for a higher cause may just give you strength you never knew you had.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Martyrdom
rules: Until end of turn, you may redirect up to 6 damage dealt to any targets to target creature.
flavor:
“The only true immortality is in dying for a higher cause than your own existence— when your courage outlives your flesh, you return to the world as hope itself.”
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Noble Steeds
rules:
{1s}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{1s}{Ws}: Target creature gains horsemanship until end of turn.
flavor:
“Only an animal born in the wild has the heart to be a true loyal Knight’s steed.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Reinforcements
rules: Put up to two target creature cards from your graveyard into your hand. You may put one additional target creature card on top of your library.
flavor:
“We aided the Balduvians once before. They need but ask and we shall do so again without the slightest hesitation.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Reprisal
rules: Destroy target creature with power 3 or greater. If it has indestructible, exile it instead.
flavor:
“The meek shall prevail in the end. For victory was never granted to those who boasted, but to those whose quiet courage shone brightest in the shadow of giants.”
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Royal Decree
rules: Whenever a Swamp, Mountain, Island, black permanent, red permanent, or blue permanent becomes tapped, Royal Decree deals 1 damage to that permanent’s controller.
flavor: “So decrees King Darien, that Kjeldor may never again be shadowed by necromancers, or pyromancers, or the frigid illusionists!”

name: Royal Herbalist
rules:
{1s}, Exile the top card of your library: You gain 3 life.
{1s}, Put a random card from your exile into your hand: You lose 1 life.
flavor: “These days, it takes serious magic—and also my gentle hand—to find something in Kjeldor that’s not seaweed.”

name: Scars of the Veteran
rules:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Scars of the Veteran’s mana cost.
Prevent the next 7 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or a loyalty counter on target planeswalker.

name: Seasoned Tactician
rules: {1s}, Mill a card: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you or a permanent you control this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor:
“No triumph in battle can match a quiet dawn without bloodshed. To keep peace is the truest measure of a ruler’s worth.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Sustaining Spirit
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Shroud}`Shroud`
During your upkeep, sacrifice Sustaining Spirit unless you pay {Ws}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
flavor: Watched over by unseen benevolence.

name: Sworn Defender
rules:
Sworn Defender can’t be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.
{1s}: Sworn Defender’s power becomes equal to toughness of target creature blocking or being blocked by it minus 1 until end of turn, and its toughness becomes 1 plus that creature’s power until end of turn.

name: Unlikely Alliance
rules: {Ws}: Target creature gets +0/+3 and gains protection from a color of your choice until end of turn. You gain life equal to that creature’s power.
flavor:
“In the icy winds of Kjeldor, trust is a rare gift, so any alliance, however strange, becomes a fortress against the storm.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Wild Aesthir
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {FirstStrike}`First strike`
{Ws}{Ws}: Wild Aesthir gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
{Ss}: Wild Aesthir gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“In our mountains, death is razor-clawed.”
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Coldsteel Heart
rules:
Coldsteel Heart enters play tapped unless you control a snow land.
As Coldsteel Heart enters play, choose a color.
{Tn}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
{Ss}: Choose a different color.
flavor: The Phyrexian heart stirs with dark power.

name: Jester's Scepter
rules:
When Jester’s Scepter enters play, exile the top five cards of target player’s library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled.
{2s}, {Tn}, Put a card exiled with Jester’s Scepter into its owner’s graveyard: Counter target spell if it has the same mana value as that card.

name: Mishra's Bauble
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice Mishra’s Bauble: Look at the top card of target player’s library. You may put that card on the bottom of their library. Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
Arcum is a babbling fool! Phyrexian technology is our greatest blessing."
—Heidar, Rimewind Master

name: Phyrexian Ironfoot
rules:
Phyrexian Ironfoot doesn’t untap during your untap step unless you control at least two other artifacts.
{Ss}: Untap Phyrexian Ironfoot.
flavor: It took the Rimewind cultists days to realize they had activated the creature— it just wasn’t interested in moving.

name: Phyrexian Snowcrusher
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
Phyrexian Snowcrusher attacks each turn if able.
{Ss}: Phyrexian Snowcrusher gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: It shatters armies as easily as it cleaves glaciers—each conquest a ruin.

name: Phyrexian Soulgorger
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
During your upkeep, sacrifice a creature or pay 3 life.
flavor: It consumes to endure the cold. Its hunger is not malice but a mandate—a feeding protocol written in alloy by Yawgmoth, calibrated to outlast the aeons torn.

name: Thrumming Stone
rules: Whenever you cast a spell, you may reveal the top 4 cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards of the same type as that spell without paying their mana costs, as long as their artwork depicts a female. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.
flavor: Its pulses invoke a hot response in women.
lore: Found half-buried in Terisiare’s last snows, the Thrumming Stone answers nearby magic with echoing ripples—spells reborn as aftershocks. The locals say it doesn’t create power—it conducts it, turning a single spell into a chorus of reflected intent. For women marked by the White Veil, its resonance can feel like a thaw inside the soul… and a dangerously sensual kind of awakening in the blood.
art: A towering stone obelisk rises from a frozen basin, its body fractured into stacked segments like a broken pillar reassembled. Pale blue energy sheets upward from the seams, as if the mountain itself is exhaling magic.

name: Balduvian Fallen
rules:
During your upkeep, put a rage counter on Balduvian Fallen.
Remove a rage counter from Balduvian Fallen: It gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{Rs}, {Tn}: Put a rage counter on Balduvian Fallen.
flavor: They fell in silence, but rose in fury.

name: Chill to the Bone
rules: Destroy target creature. {BL} {BL} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} If that creature is snow, exile it instead, and you lose 2 life.
flavor:
“The living see death as an end. I see it as an archive, storing what once struggled, now made still and beautiful, preserved in subservience beneath frozen winds.”
—Heidar, Rimewind Master

name: Chilling Shade
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
#Snow landfall# — Whenever a snow land enters play under your control, Chilling Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{Ss}: Chilling Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Souls linger in the Rimewind mist.

name: Deathmark
flavor:
“At least every snowflake is unique, so I won’t have to see one like this again.”
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran Patrol

name: Disciple of Tevesh Szat
rules:
{Tn}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{4s}{Bs}, {Tn}, Sacrifice this card: Target creature gets -6/-6 until end of turn.
flavor: “You pray to Freyalise, but she cannot hear your pleas—Tevesh Szat will claim your soul and relish the torment.”

name: Feast of Flesh
rules: Feast of Flesh deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is 1 plus the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.
flavor:
“Starving an army that feeds on its enemies is a very sound strategy—especially when they forget which side they are dying for.”
—Garza Zol, Plague Queen

name: Garza's Assassin
rules:
Sacrifice Garza’s Assassin: Destroy target nonblack creature.
When another creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay 3 life. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to play.
flavor: Garza Zol allied with Heidar following the Thaw, but later had him murdered.

name: Grim Harvest
rules:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay {2s}{Bs}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: What the Thaw forgets, the ice remembers.

name: Gristle Grinner
rules: Whenever a creature dies, Gristle Grinner gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor:
“You see one of those, you run. Fast. Whatever it wants, you’re not on the menu—until you stop moving. It chattered its teeth like it was mocking our chances, each click promising a slow, grisly end.”
—Aevar Borg, journal entry

name: Gutless Ghoul
rules: {1s}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 3 life. If mana spent to activate this ability was from a snow source, you gain 6 life instead.
flavor:
“Make sure those wretches feed only upon the plagued. The blood of the healthy is reserved for me alone.”
—Garza Zol, Plague Queen

name: Haakon, Stromgald Scourge
rules:
You may cast Haakon from your graveyard, but not from anywhere else.
As long as Haakon is in play, you may play Knight and Zombie cards from your graveyard.
When Haakon dies, you lose 2 life.
flavor: Cold earth cannot hold his wrath.
lore: The Badlands remember Haakon as a ruler who refused the mercy of endings, returning in dark armor that gleamed where no light should live. Heidar’s cause suited him: undo the Thaw, freeze hope, and make every battlefield a harvest for Stromgald’s ranks. At Kjeldor he dueled King Darien from dusk till dawn, a legend written in steel and fear. When the living finally dragged him down, it wasn’t victory that lingered—it was the cost of daring to finish him.
art: A towering figure in jagged, midnight mail advances with slow certainty, green fire burning behind the visor. The distant fortress—Stromgald’s brooding hold—looms like a promise he intends to keep. Snow is present, but it’s the silence that feels weaponized.

name: Herald of Leshrac
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
During your upkeep, gain control of a land you don’t control.
Herald of Leshrac gets +1/+1 for each land you control but don’t own. When Herald of Leshrac leaves play, return all lands to their owners.

name: Krovikan Rot
rules:
Destroy target creature with either power or toughness 2 or less.
When a creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay {Bs}{Bs}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: When the Thaw reached Krov, it carried more than warmth—it carried ruin.

name: Krovikan Scoundrel
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Deathtouch}

name: Martyr of Bones
rules:
When Martyr of Bones enters play, you may exile target card from a graveyard.
Reveal X black cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Bones: Exile up to X target cards from a single graveyard.
flavor: The Frost Marsh claimed their bodies— then Haakon claimed what remained, using it for his army of the damned.

name: Phobian Phantasm
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {Fear}

name: Phyrexian Etchings
rules:
During your upkeep, put a revelation counter on Phyrexian Etchings.
At your end step, draw a card for each revelation counter on this card.
When Phyrexian Etchings is put into a graveyard from play, you lose 3 life for each revelation counter on it.

name: Rime Transfusion
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has “{Ss}: This creature can’t be blocked this turn except by snow creatures.”
flavor: They screamed not in pain, but in the shock of forgetting warmth—and mercy.

name: Rimebound Dead
rules: {Ss}: Rimebound Dead gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
“Tresserhorn is ours now. Dredge the lake deep and bring me all the bones you can find beneath its dark waters, where no light dares reach. We’ll build you a new army, the likes of which Terisiare has never seen.”
—Heidar, to Haakon

name: Soul Spike
rules:
You may exile two black cards from your hand rather than pay Soul Spike’s mana cost.
Soul Spike deals 5 damage to any target and you gain 5 life.
flavor: What good is a kingdom, if the cold has devoured everything that made you alive?

name: Stromgald Crusader
rules:
{ProtectionW}`Protection from white`
{1s}: Stromgald Crusader gains flying until end of turn.
{Bs}: Stromgald Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: “Those White-Shielders have no idea how their code binds their hands.”

name: Surging Dementia
rules: Reveal the top 4 cards of your library. Target player discards X cards where X equals 1 plus the number of cards revealed with artwork depicting a female. Put the revealed cards in your graveyard.
flavor: They call it the White Veil. Most women in Dominaria suffer from its quiet unraveling.

name: Tresserhorn Skyknight
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Menace}`Menace`
When Tresserhorn Skyknight enters play, if a snow land was tapped to cast it, return target creature card from your graveyard to play.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Tresserhorn Skyknight by creatures with first strike.

name: Void Maw
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Trample}`Trample`
If another creature would die, exile it instead.
Put a card exiled with Void Maw into its owner’s graveyard: Void Maw gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: No one alive knows what’s inside.

name: Zombie Musher
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Menace} {Snowwalk}

name: Allosaurus Rider
rules:
You may exile two green cards from your hand rather than pay Allosaurus Rider’s mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider’s power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control. If you paid the mana cost, increase that by the number of different basic land types you control.

name: Arctic Nishoba
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
During your upkeep you may pay {Gs} or {Ws}, then put a vitality counter on Arctic Nishoba if you paid with green mana, or put two vitality counters on it if you paid with white mana.
When Arctic Nishoba dies, you gain 2 life for each vitality counter on it.

name: Aurochs Herd
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
When Aurochs Herd enters play, you may search your library for an animal creature card and put it into your hand.
Whenever Aurochs Herd attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking animal creature.

name: Boreal Centaur
rules: {Ss}: Boreal Centaur gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate only up to three times each turn.
flavor:
“We do not flee storms—we race beside them. Our hooves carry the memory of glaciers, and our chests beat with the will of ten thousand winters.”
—Ukoten, Centaur Chieftain

name: Boreal Druid
rules: {Tn}: Add {Cs} or {Ss}.
flavor: “Some creatures are bound to the cold by Rimewind’s will. Others come willingly, shaped by the long frost. We, the druids, walk between them, wrapped in silence and snowlight, listening to the ice—and answering without fire.”

name: Brooding Saurian
rules:
Creatures your opponents control lose all abilities during your turn.
At your end step, gain control of all permanents you own.
flavor:
“Day six. The beast hums lullabies and piles snow over us. I fear we’ve been adopted. It’s probably getting ready to name us.”
—Aevar Borg, journal entry

name: Bull Aurochs
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
Whenever Bull Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking animal creature.
flavor: No one’s sure what set him off. Maybe a snowflake landed wrong or maybe the tundra was just asking for it.

name: Freyalise's Radiance
rules:
During your upkeep, pay {2s} or sacrifice Freyalise’s Radiance.
When this enchantment enters play, tap all snow permanents. They don’t untap during their controllers’ untap steps.
flavor: When Freyalise cast the World Spell, the land finally revealed its forgotten soul.

name: Frostweb Spider
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`
Whenever Frostweb Spider blocks a creature with flying, put a +1/+1 counter on Frostweb Spider at end of combat.
flavor: It lurks like rime ice, its web a silent trap spun from winter’s oldest curse.

name: Hibernation's End
rules: During your upkeep, you may pay {Gs} from a non-snow land. If you do, put a waking counter on Hibernation’s End, then search your library for a creature card with mana value equal to the number of waking counters on it and put it into play.
flavor: Their breath steams, their hunger stirs.

name: Into the North
rules: Search your library for a snow land card and put it into play tapped.
flavor:
“The border glades sleep beneath the hush of Heidar’s second winter. But the roots still breathe, and the land still dreams of sunlight. Go now, and awaken it softly back to Yavimaya’s embrace.”
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of Juniper Order

name: Karplusan Strider
rules:
{Snowwalk}`Snow landwalk`
Karplusan Strider can’t be the target of white, blue, or black spells.
flavor:
“Watch its stride, each step so measured. That’s how they vanish between drifts—not by speed, but by knowing the snow.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Martyr of Spores
rules: {Gs}, Reveal any number of green cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Spores: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn where X equals twice the number of revealed cards.
flavor: “Weep not for me. We both know I will rise even more beautiful next spring.”

name: Mystic Melting
Ohran Viper
rules:
Whenever Ohran Viper deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Whenever Ohran Viper deals combat damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters and you draw a card.
flavor: This viper’s veins course with the same antigelid venom used to kill its prey.

name: Panglacial Wurm
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
While you’re searching your library, you may cast Panglacial Wurm from your library.
flavor:
“Step lightly and we might be able to use it as a bridge—or ride to the next valley.”
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Resize
rules:
Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.
If that creature dies this turn, return it to your hand.
flavor: Yavimaya does not choose its champions. The forest knows only those who rise, no matter how small their beginnings.

name: Rimehorn Aurochs
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
Whenever Rimehorn Aurochs attacks, other attacking snow creatures get +1/+0 and trample until end of turn.
{2s}{Ss}: Target creature blocks target creature this turn if able.
flavor: They follow no trail, they leave it.

name: Ronom Hulk
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {ProtectionS}

name: Shape of the Wiitigo
rules:
Enchant creature
When this aura enters play, put seven +1/+1 counters on enchanted creature. During your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature if it attacked or blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from enchanted creature.

name: Sheltering Ancient
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
When Sheltering Ancient enters play, and during your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on a creature an opponent controls.
flavor: Its endless wooden limbs grant uneasy, yet enduring shelter to the frail.

name: Simian Brawler
rules: Discard a land card: Simian Brawler gets +3/+3 until end of turn if you discarded a Forest, or +2/+2 if not.
flavor:
“Even in fury, they remember who gave them shelter—and how to protect it.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Sound the Call
rules: Lands you control become 2/2 Beast creatures with vigilance until end of turn. They’re still lands.
flavor:
“If you call the wolves, you best be ready to bleed, run, and howl beside them— through tangled thickets, moonlit snows, and, of course, the endless hunt.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Steam Spitter
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`  {ProtectionS}`Protection from snow`
{Rs}: Steam Spitter gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“Day four. Why can’t this thing just spit the usual venom? Something tells me this isn’t just a bad day—this is my life now.”
—Aevar Borg, journal entry

name: Surging Might
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.
You may cast enchantments with artwork depicting a female without paying their mana cost.
flavor: “Strength is my birthright. The wind bows. The beasts make way. And you?”

name: Blizzard Specter
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
When Blizzard Specter deals combat damage to a player, choose one—
• That player returns a permanent they control to its owner’s hand.
• That player discards a card.
flavor: Death comes wailing on the wind.

name: Deepfire Elemental
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Xs}{2s}: Destroy target artifact or creature with mana value X.
flavor:
“White above, red below. The frost is a mask, thin as breath. Beneath it, the old fires wait, coiled in silence, burning still.”
—Sek’Kuar, Deathkeeper

name: Diamond Faerie
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Ss}: Snow creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
“That such delicate creatures could become so powerful in the embrace of winter is yet more proof that I am right. Cold refines.”
—Heidar, Rimewind Master

name: Garza Zol, Plague Queen
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Haste}`Haste`
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Garza Zol, Plague Queen this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Garza Zol.
Whenever Garza Zol deals combat damage to a player, they get a poison counter and you may draw a card.
flavor: “Come closer. I promise the last thing you’ll feel is important.”
lore: The Plague Queen’s court is built on appetite and patience—strike fast, leave scars, and let consequences do the rest. Krov’s nobles learned to smile while bleeding, because Garza Zol prefers her subjects conscious of what she is. Heidar believed he could steer her; he learned too late that she only follows a path until it becomes inconvenient. Wherever she passes, strength accumulates—and those she marks rarely remain alive long enough to complain.
art: A vampire queen strides forward with predatory grace, every movement equal parts seduction and sentence. Her dress is midnight and smoke, baring just enough to weaponize attention while her expression promises violence with a smile. The forest behind her feels like Krov itself—silent, watching, and already complicit.

name: Juniper Order Ranger
rules: Whenever another creature enters play under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature and a +1/+1 counter on Juniper Order Ranger.
flavor: To protect the alliance between Kjeldor and Yavimaya, the knights of Juniper Order trained in the ways of both.

name: Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper
rules: Whenever another creature you control dies, return a creature card with equal or lesser mana value from your graveyard to play.
flavor: Among Karplusan peaks, legends tell of an orc so ferocious that he burned his own kin—yet the devotion he inspired called them to rise from ashes once more.
lore: Sek’Kuar’s legend begins with a bargain no sane shaman would make: a cosmic hunger whispered into his skull, and he answered “yes.” With that borrowed eldritch spark, he gathered orcs like a storm-front and marched them wherever the world was weakest—battlefields, famine camps, and the sick streets of Krov. He treated followers as fuel, yet their loyalty only deepened, dragged back from death by the gravity of his will. Terisiare remembers him as a moving calamity: part prophet, part butcher, and never entirely mortal.
art: Sek’Kuar’s posture is calm in the way disasters are calm: centered, certain, and not remotely apologetic. The radiant staff crowns him like a cruel sun, hinting at the Void Maw’s gift—power that looks holy for the brief moment before it eats you.

name: Tamanoa
rules: Whenever a source you control deals damage, you gain that much life. If it was a non-creature source, put a +1/+1 counter on Tamanoa.
flavor: When Freyalise spoke the World Spell, its power echoed across the continent, and the Tamanoa rose, radiant and resolute, to bring a new morning to the land.

name: Vanish into Memory
rules: Exile target creature. You draw cards equal to that creature’s power. During your next upkeep, return that card into play under its owner’s control, then discard cards equal to that creature’s toughness minus 2.
flavor: Vanished into the snow, yet its memory remains sharp as ice, cold and unyielding.

name: Wilderness Elemental
rules:
Trample
Wilderness Elemental’s power is equal to 1 plus the number of nonbasic lands in play.
flavor: It may not be the best idea to reclaim the thawing lands right away. They might have acquired a taste of freedom.

name: Zur the Enchanter
rules:
Flying
Whenever Zur attacks, you may search your library for an enchantment card with mana value 3 or less and put it into play.
flavor: Zur ignored Terisiare’s suffering, intent only on his own perfection.
lore: Zur’s story is a straight line drawn through other people’s lives: ambition, conflict, disappearance, and the quiet reward of outlasting everyone. Exiled for his “insane” pursuit of immortality, he turned the wilderness into a laboratory and the cold into a warded sanctuary. When the glaciers began to loosen and his followers fled toward Kjeld, they carried his name like a shameful heirloom. Zur himself remained the same—aloof, perfected, and still convinced the world exists to be improved into a mirror.
art: Zur stands before Kjeldoran stone in a crimson mantle that looks almost ceremonial—an exile who never stopped seeing himself as royalty. The staff’s bright sphere is too controlled to be comfort; it’s craftsmanship, precision, and quiet arrogance made visible. His gesture reads like instruction, as though reality is a student who keeps getting the lesson wrong.

name: Arctic Flats
rules:
Arctic Flats enters play tapped unless you already control a snow permanent.
{Tn}: Add {Gs} or {Ws}.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Add {Gs}{Ws}.
Whenever you cast a snow spell, you may untap Arctic Flats.

name: Boreal Shelf
rules:
Boreal Shelf enters play tapped unless you already control a snow permanent.
{Tn}: Add {Ws} or {Us}.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Add {Ws}{Us}.
Whenever you cast a snow spell, you may untap Boreal Shelf.

name: Dark Depths of Ronom
rules:
Dark Depths of Ronom enters play with ten ice counters on it.
{2s}: Remove an ice counter from Dark Depths. When it has no counters on it, sacrifice it. Create a legendary 20/20 black Avatar creature token with flying and indestructible named Marit Lage.
flavor: Awakened from the void of dark dreams.
lore: Ronom’s “dark depths” are not a chasm but a prison-site: a drowned vault sunk under ancient ice, where the cold was shaped into a binding rather than weather. The surface looks like any hard, pale wasteland—until you feel the wrongness beneath, a pressure that makes magic hesitate. After the Thaw’s first decades, meltwater carved new seas and revealed the land’s northern edge, but nothing rose to greet it. That absence became its own terror, and sailors learned to give the region a wide berth.
art: The Ronom shelf lies deceptively calm under a pale sky, a smooth lid of ice over water that looks too dark to be honest. Beneath the surface, the shape is only half-seen—massive, submerged, and patient—like a secret the land keeps against its own conscience. The distant ridges feel small, as if the world learned humility here.

name: Frost Marsh
rules:
Frost Marsh enters play tapped unless you already control a snow permanent.
{Tn}: Add {Us} or {Bs}.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Add {Us}{Bs}.
Whenever you cast a snow spell, you may untap Frost Marsh.

name: Highland Weald
rules:
This land enters play tapped unless you already control a snow permanent.
{Tn}: Add {Rs} or {Gs}.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Add {Rs}{Gs}.
Whenever you cast a snow spell, you may untap Highland Weald.

name: Mouth of Ronom
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Tap target creature with toughness 4 or more. It doesn’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.
{2s}{Ss}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Mouth of Ronom: Destroy target creature.
flavor: Its depths will swallow the unwary whole.
lore: Ronom Glacier stretched from the northeastern Colekgan Mountains down toward Ronom Lake, and its meltwater once drew treasure-hunters like flies to a lantern. The Mouth is where that temptation becomes personal: an accessible threshold into a mass of ice too vast to comprehend, riddled with fissures and ancient chambers. Here, the cold is not weather but a ward, laid over things that should not wake—constructs, Phyrexian war-beasts, and darker prisons still. Even after the World Spell began the Flooding of Terisiare, the Mouth remained a warning: the glacier may retreat, but it does not forget what it kept.
art: The Mouth of Ronom opens onto a frozen hall where the walls curve like a throat, slick with layers that suggest centuries of sealing and reshaping. Cold light spills in from outside, revealing only the first chamber—never the depths beyond.

name: Scrying Sheets
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Look at the top card of your library. If that card is snow, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.
flavor: Through Ronom Glacier’s pearly ice one could see frozen Phyrexian war-beasts, an omen of the future shaped by the Thaw.

name: Tresserhorn Sinks
rules:
This land enters play tapped unless you already control a snow permanent.
{Tn}: Add {Bs} or {Rs}.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Add {Bs}{Rs}.
Whenever you cast a snow spell, you may untap Tresserhorn Sinks.

name: Balduvian Rage
rules:
Target attacking creature gets +X/+2 until end of turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“Let your heartbeat be the thunder and your swords be the lightning.”
—Lothar Lovisason, Balduvian chieftain

name: Balduvian Warlord
rules:
{FirstStrike}`First strike`
{Tn}: Target blocking creature instead blocks an attacking creature of your choice. Activate at declare blockers step.
flavor: His mere presence is enough to confuse the weak-minded among his enemies, a silent storm of despair clouding all reason.

name: Braid of Fire
rules: During your upkeep, put a lava counter on this permanent. Then add {Rs} for each lava counter on Braid of Fire.
flavor:
“To a trained mind, the cold is just a fleeting shiver. Fire, though? Fire never forgets. Power tangles itself in heat, just waiting for hands like ours to tease it free.”
—Jaya Ballard, planeswalker

name: Cryoclasm
rules:
Kicker {Ss}
Destroy target Plains or Island.
If Cryoclasm was kicked, destroy target Swamp or Forest instead.
Cryoclasm deals 4 damage to that land’s controller.
flavor: Solid ground is just a rumor around here.

name: Earthen Goo
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
During your upkeep, you may pay {Rs} or {Gs}. If you paid with red mana, put a +1/+1 counter on Earthen Goo. If you paid with green mana, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: It doesn’t really know how to walk, it only knows how to spread—everywhere.

name: Fury of the Horde
rules:
You may exile two red cards from your hand rather than pay Fury of the Horde’s mana cost. If you paid the mana cost, draw two cards.
Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

name: Goblin Furrier
rules:
Prevent all damage that Goblin Furrier would deal to snow creatures.
Whenever Goblin Furrier blocks or becomes blocked by a snow creature, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: On a powdery slope, the goblin chanced upon something furry. There they regarded each other—the goblin and his new coat.

name: Goblin Rimerunner
rules:
{Haste}`Haste`
{Ss}{Ss}: Goblin Rimerunner gains menace until end of turn.
{Tn}: Target creature can’t block this turn.
flavor: Rimerunners hurl themselves down the mountain just to start avalanches—then steer them toward foes and tourists.

name: Greater Stone Spirit
rules:
Greater Stone Spirit can’t be blocked by creatures with flying.
{Rs}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
{Rs}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A mountain decides to stand up.

name: Icefall
rules:
Destroy target artifact or land.
When a creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay {Rs}{Rs}{Rs}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The glacier cracked, groaned, and fell— its death cry echoed through the gorge.

name: Karplusan Minotaur
rules:
During your upkeep, put a flip counter on this card. Then flip a coin as many times as there are flip counters on it.
Whenever you win a coin flip, Karplusan Minotaur deals 2 damage to any target. Whenever you lose a coin flip, it deals 1 damage to any target of an opponent’s choice.

name: Karplusan Wolverine
rules: Whenever Karplusan Wolverine attacks or becomes blocked, you may have it deal 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
“They’re not easily trained. Fortunately, they already know how to kill.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Lightning Serpent
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`  {Haste}`Haste`
Lightning Serpent enters play with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Sacrifice Lightning Serpent at the next end step.
flavor: They say it coils in the heart of volcanoes, just waiting for the sky to scream.

name: Lightning Storm
rules:
Lightning Storm deals X damage to any target, where X is 4 plus the number of charge counters on it.
Discard a land card: Put two charge counters on Lightning Storm. You may choose a new target for it. Any player may activate this but only if Lightning Storm is on the stack.

name: Lovisa Coldeyes
rules: Each creature that’s a Barbarian, a Warrior, a Shaman, or a Berserker gets +2/+2, has haste and snowwalk.
flavor: “I lead my horde to the northwest. I won’t return until the ice wizards fall and their fiendish contraptions are crushed beneath our boots and burnt from the snow!”
lore: Few Balduvians wore blonde hair, fewer still wore authority like armor—Lovisa did both, and neither was for show. She hid Jodah until his mind returned, answered his call against Lim-Dûl, and kept her people moving when fear tried to make them small. Her son’s union with Darien’s line stitched Balduvia to Kjeldor, warming a path toward New Argive even as ice still ruled the land. At Rimewind Keep, she refused to yield, and Heidar learned that killing a chieftain doesn’t kill what she teaches.
art: Lovisa lounges on a carved throne like conquest at rest—broad-shouldered, powerfully built, and unapologetically feminine in fur and bright metal. Her gaze earns the name “Coldeyes,” steady and assessing, the look of a leader who measures threats the way others measure distance. The relaxed posture isn’t softness—it’s dominance that no longer needs to prove itself.

name: Magmatic Core
rules:
During your upkeep, you may pay {1s}{Rs}. If you do, put a lava counter on Magmatic Core.
At your end step, Magmatic Core deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of lava counters on it.
flavor: Even the coldest peaks burn from within.

name: Martyr of Ashes
rules: {1s}, Reveal X red cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Ashes: It deals X damage to each creature without flying.
flavor: They burned her home. She learned to burn them back—flesh, soul, shadow, memory, and snow alike.

name: Ohran Yeti
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`
{2s}{Ss}: Target snow creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Snowdrifts hide many things, but only one takes aim. The Yeti waits, cocked with a frozen spear. When his eyes find yours, the throw is already midair.

name: Orcish Bloodpainter
rules:
{Haste}`Haste`
{1s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice a creature: Orcish Bloodpainter deals damage equal to that creature’s toughness to any target.
Whenever Orcish Bloodpainter deals damage, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

name: Rimescale Dragon
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{2s}{Ss}: Tap target creature and put an ice counter on it.
Creatures with ice counters on them don’t untap during their controllers’ untap steps.
flavor: Its breath does not burn, it freezes.

name: Rite of Flame
rules: Add {Rs}{Rs}, then add {Rs} for each red card in each graveyard.
flavor:
“They think the world is ice now, but I have seen what sleeps below—the fire that remembers, the heat that waits. {BL2} {BL2} And when we call to it, it answers.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Skred
rules: Skred deals damage to target creature equal to the number of snow permanents you control.
flavor:
“This close to Rimewind Keep, no avalanche is nature’s doing. The snow falls where the sorcerers point, and the mountain buries only who they name.”
—Ukoten, Centaur Chieftain

name: Stalking Yeti
rules:
When Stalking Yeti enters play, it deals 3 damage to target creature.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Return Stalking Yeti to its owner’s hand.
flavor:
“You don’t hear it come. You don’t hear it go. You just stop hearing.”
—Ukoten, Centaur Chieftain

name: Surging Flame
rules: Reveal the top 4 cards of your library. Surging Flame deals X damage to any target where X equals 4 plus the number of cards revealed with artwork depicting a female. Put the revealed cards into your graveyard.
flavor: “Men called us weak. So we set their halls on fire and carved our names in smoke.”

name: Thermopod
flavor: Born of heat beneath the frost, it skims the snowfields like a shadow with teeth.

name: Adarkar Windform
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{1s}{Ss}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
flavor:
“In Terisiare, the weather forecast is as fickle as a wizard’s familiar. Weird doesn’t even begin to describe it.”
—Aevar Borg, Northern Guide

name: Arcum Dagsson
rules: {Tn}: Target player sacrifices an artifact. That player may search their library for a noncreature artifact card and put it into play.
flavor: “Artifice sundered the world. With unyielding resolve, I vow it shall not again wreak such sorrow.”
lore: Arcum was small in stature and sharp in presence, a mind that moved faster than the cold could bite. Soldev’s workshops became his cathedral: relics studied, designs replicated, and new constructs forged with the confidence of a man trying to outthink history. The city’s destruction shattered that confidence into something colder and cleaner—remorse that refused comfort. Afterward, he spent what remained of his life chasing repair instead of acclaim, warning Kjeldor of Heidar’s awakened war-beasts and fighting to keep old mistakes from finding new names.
art: Arcum stands in the frozen wastes in his blue coat, hair and beard whipped into wild gray—an immaculate mind trapped in an unkind world. Beside him looms a Soldevi war-beast, all rivets and jaws, the kind of “aid” that can become a sentence if it slips its leash. His hand on the metal reads like ownership and regret at once.

name: Balduvian Frostwaker
