rules: {Us}, {Tn}: Target snow land becomes a 2/2 blue Elemental creature with flying. It’s still a land.
flavor: “The land, in all its frozen majesty, heeds our call. From snow-capped peaks to icy tundras, it rises to defend us, forming an alliance as strong as the frost itself.”

name: Commandeer
rules:
You may exile two blue cards from your hand rather than pay Commandeer’s mana cost.
Gain control of target noncreature spell. You may choose new targets for it.
If you paid Commandeer’s mana cost, return it to your hand at end of turn.

name: Controvert
rules:
Counter target spell.
When a creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay {1s}{Us}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Ambition fades with the falling snow, cold memory calls the willful back again.

name: Counterbalance
rules: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may reveal the top card of your library. If you do, counter that spell if it has the same mana value as the revealed card. If the revealed card is a snow permanent, you may scry 1.
flavor: In the silence of drifting snowflakes, every future is already written—quiet, unnoticed.

name: Drelnoch
rules: Whenever Drelnoch becomes blocked, you may draw two cards.
flavor:
“Day three. Adarkar’s desolate chill mocks our every step. We must stay sharp. One slip of the mind, and a Drelnoch will pounce—although, at least then we’d have some company in this cursed wasteland.”
—Aevar Borg, journal entry

name: Flashfreeze
rules: Counter target black, red or green spell. If a spell is countered this way, you may draw a card.
flavor:
“Nature? Fire? Darkness? Bah! All are chaotic and difficult to control. The cold eventually claims all who defy order. Only in ice, there is true power!”
—Heidar, Rimewind Master

name: Frost Raptor
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Ss}{Ss}: Frost Raptor gains shroud until end of turn.
flavor: The Rimewind wizards were obsessed with creating an eternal winter. Their twisted magic manipulated the essence of snow, corrupting it into something vile.

name: Frozen Solid
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn’t untap during its controller’s untap step.
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
When Frozen Solid leaves play, you may draw a card.

name: Heidar, Rimewind Master
rules: {Tn}: Return target permanent to its owner’s hand. Activate only if you control 3 or more snow permanents.
flavor: “The umber stain of the Thaw will be bleached away, the lands will shiver as the frost reclaims its dominion. Once again, the world will be sharp, white, and flawless— just as it was always meant to be!”
lore: The Cult of Rimewind began as a refuge; under Heidar it became a knife pointed at the Thaw. Initiated young and gifted with an instinctive command of ice, he rose fast, terrified by southern warmth and the plagues it seemed to invite. He built his counterattack through alliances no honest mage would touch—Stromgald’s undead discipline, Krov’s corrupt elementalism, Lim-Dûl’s knowledge buried at Tresserhorn. The Phyrexians answered his call with metal hunger, and the ensuing rampage made his dream undeniable: if he could not preserve the cold, he would weaponize it, no matter what it devoured.
art: A cryomaster in rough robes and furs commands the air with a controlled fury, as if the world itself is a disobedient student. The blue fire atop his staff reads like frozen witchlight—beautiful, unnatural, and meant to dominate. Snow flickers in last, incidental to the sharper violence of his magic.

name: Jokulmorder
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
When Jokulmorder enters play, sacrifice it unless you return three lands to your hand. Jokulmorder enters play tapped.
Jokulmorder doesn’t untap during your untap step. You may untap it whenever you play an Island or a snow land.

name: Krovikan Mist
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
Krovikan Mist’s power and toughness are each equal to the number of Illusions, Horrors, Elementals, and/or Spirits in play.
flavor: Plague-induced dreams became real as they swirled above Krov, mingling with the magical residue of the World Spell.

name: Krovikan Whispers
rules:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
When Krovikan Whispers is put into a graveyard from play, target player loses 1 life for each counter in play.
flavor:
Dark whispers linger where certainty dies,
soft as a breath, yet sharper than lies.

name: Martyr of Frost
rules: {1s}, Reveal X blue cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Frost: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {Xs}.
flavor:
“Do not call the Balduvians barbaric. It would be foolish to underestimate them. Their magic is as potent as it is primal.”
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Perilous Research
rules: Draw two cards, then sacrifice a permanent.
flavor:
“We carry the essence of the Unseen within us—its knowledge, its power, its spirit. Though thieves may covet our secrets and our academy may fall, our magic will still illuminate new horizons.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Rimefeather Owl
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Shroud}`Shroud`
Rimefeather Owl’s power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow permanents in play.
{Ss}: Put an ice counter on target permanent. Permanents with ice counters on them are snow.

name: Rimewind Cryomancer
rules: {Tn}: Counter target activated ability. Activate only if you control three or more snow permanents.
flavor:
“The Thaw brings flooding, disease, and death to our beloved land. My devoted cryomancers will do all in their power to bring frigid peace back to the world.”
—Heidar, Rimewind Master

name: Rimewind Taskmage
rules: {1s}, {Tn}: You may tap or untap target permanent. Activate only if you control 3 or more snow permanents.
flavor:
“Finding solace in the sun? Burning, blinding, laying secrets bare? I don’t think so, real solace is found under the blanket of cold, far away from the sunlight.”
—Heidar, Rimewind Master

name: Ronom Serpent
rules:
Ronom Serpent can’t attack unless defending player controls a snow land.
When you control no snow lands, sacrifice Ronom Serpent.
{Tn}: Tap target non-snow creature.
flavor: As the Rimewind deepened its icy grasp, ancient predators rose from the ice.

name: Rune Snag
rules: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2s} plus an additional {2s} for each card with ‘Counter target spell’ in its text in each graveyard.
flavor:
“Concentration is key. Without it, a mage conjures nothing but a headache. Even the slightest distraction can spell doom.”
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Surging AEther
rules:
Return target permanent to its owner’s hand.
Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any instants with artwork depicting a female without paying their mana cost. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.
flavor: Æther energy is highly soothing for females.

name: Survivor of the Unseen
rules:
During your upkeep, sacrifice Survivor of the Unseen unless you pay {1s}.
{Tn}: Draw two cards, then put a card from your hand on top of your library.
flavor: “My survival came not from magic or destruction, but from walking away when all others chose to vanish.”

name: Thermal Flux
rules:
Choose one —
• Three target nonsnow permanents become snow until end of turn.
• Three target snow permanents aren’t snow until end of turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.

name: Vexing Sphinx
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
During your upkeep, you may discard a card. If you do, put an ice counter on Vexing Sphinx. If you don’t, sacrifice it.
When Vexing Sphinx dies, draw a card for each ice counter on it.

name: Adarkar Valkyrie
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Vigilance}`Vigilance`
{Tn}: When target creature other than Adarkar Valkyrie dies this turn, return that card into play under your control.
flavor: She doesn’t escort the dead to the afterlife, but instead she raises them to fight for her cause, just so they can die again.

name: Boreal Griffin
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Ss}: Boreal Griffin gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
“More than snow falls from the Boreal skies. With the chill of death, the cold winds herald the descent of the beast.”
—Arkin Egilsson, Skycaptain

name: Cover of Winter
rules:
If a creature would deal combat damage to you and/or one or more creatures you control, prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of ice counters on Cover of Winter.
{Ss}: Put an ice counter on this card.
flavor: What dies in the frost is never lost—winter veils, but never forgets. Its touch is eternal.

name: Darien, King of Kjeldor
rules: Whenever you’re dealt damage, you may distribute that many +1/+1 counters among any other creatures you control.
flavor: With his dream of unification fulfilled, Darien became the last king of Kjeldor. The leaders who followed were known as the kings of New Argive.
lore: Plague and intrigue tried to make Darien a footnote—wives lost to Krov’s sickness, factions eager to trade the crown for profit, enemies eager to trade it for blood. Instead he became the hinge on which Kjeldor turned: rescued from assassination, awakened to Lim-Dûl’s schemes, and sharpened into a ruler who could command both steel and loyalty. He fought beside Balduvia in the last great struggles of the Ice Age, then spent the Thaw’s early years building a peace sturdy enough to survive winter’s memory. The land did not keep his title, but it kept his name—etched into towns and lakes like a vow.
art: A broad-shouldered king Darien sits the saddle like a soldier, not a parade piece, his gold plate dulled by use and cold. The crown is present, but the expression is the real authority—alert, burdened, and quietly furious at the costs he’s had to pay.

name: Field Marshal
rules: Soldiers you control get +1/+1 and have first strike.
flavor:
“The Knights of Stromgald struck our outpost from two sides. They would have caught us in a pincer attack were it not for the cunning of my tacticians. But now, we stood strong in the face of their assault.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Gelid Shackles
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can’t block, and its activated abilities can’t be activated.
{Ss}: Enchanted creature gains defender until end of turn.
flavor: Shackled by ice, frozen in eternal stillness, your struggles silenced by winter’s breath.

name: Glacial Plating
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 for each ice counter on Glacial Plating.
{Xs}{Ss}: Put an ice counter on Glacial Plating, where X equals the number of ice counters on it.
flavor: Hardened ice can be stronger than metal.

name: Jotun Grunt
rules: During your upkeep, put a card from any graveyard on the bottom of their owner’s library, or sacrifice Jötun Grunt.
flavor: Giants of the Jötun tribe stood with the Kjeldorans in the fight against the Order of Stromgald. Bound by honor, their footsteps shook the earth as they tore through the enemy lines in the coldest of winters.

name: Jotun Owl Keeper
rules:
During your upkeep, put an owl counter on Jötun Owl Keeper.
Jötun Owl Keeper gets +1/+1 for each owl counter on it.
Remove an owl counter: Jötun Owl Keeper deals 1 damage to target player or creature with flying.

name: Kjeldoran Gargoyle
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {FirstStrike} {Lifelink}

name: Kjeldoran Javelineer
rules:
During your upkeep, pay {Ws} and put a level counter on Kjeldoran Javelineer, or sacrifice it.
{Tn}: Kjeldoran Javelineer deals damage equal to the number of level counters on it to target attacking or blocking creature.

name: Kjeldoran Outrider
rules:
{Ws}: Kjeldoran Outrider gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{Tn}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: One listens to the whispers of men, the other listens to the rumble of wind—both sense the dark shadows on horizon.

name: Kjeldoran War Cry
rules: Creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 1 plus the number of instants in all graveyards.
flavor:
“Even in the darkest of winters, we are the light that will pierce through. My breath may crystallize on the wind, but our war cries burn like fire in our hearts.”
—Darien, King of Kjeldor

name: Luminesce
rules: Prevent all damage that nonwhite sources would deal this turn.
flavor:
“The White Shield is not merely the metal forged to protect you, it is the light that burns within, the conviction that cannot be shaken, even by the coldest winds.”
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Martyr of Sands
rules: {1s}, Reveal X white cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Sands: You gain three times X life.
flavor: “Only in our vulnerability and sacrifice do we find true power. It is the strength to stand bare before the winds, unprotected by armor, knowing that through the pain and the trial, we are reborn.”

name: Ronom Unicorn
rules:
{Lifelink}`Lifelink`
Sacrifice Ronom Unicorn: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor: The abberant magic of Rimewind stirred the unicorns from slumber, bringing these ethereal beings to frigid battles, where their power and grace were unmatched.

name: Squall Drifter
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Ws}, {Tn}: Tap target creature.
flavor:
“The scouts say the wind’s got malice and a temper. I’m starting to believe them— every step we take, it seems to move the horizon just to make sure we’re lost.”
—Aevar Borg, journal entry

name: Sun's Bounty
rules:
You gain 5 life.
When a creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay {1s}{Ws}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Heidar has forced the sun into hiding, but the sun hasn’t forgotten the Terisian Isles.

name: Sunscour
rules:
You may exile two white cards from your hand rather than pay Sunscour’s mana cost.
Destroy all creatures. If you paid the mana cost, exile them instead.
flavor:
“Day twenty-three. I used to fear the cold—now I fear what comes after it.”
—Aevar Borg, journal entry

name: Surging Sentinels
rules: As Surging Sentinels enters play, reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put any creatures with artwork depicting a female into play without paying their mana cost. Put the remaining cards on the bottom of your library.
flavor: Dedicated protectors of the delicate.

name: Swift Maneuver
rules:
Prevent up to 3 damage that would be dealt this turn, divided among any number of targets.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor: Darien’s call to Yavimaya would have fallen red to the snow had it not been for the agility and the speed of the aesthir.

name: Ursine Fylgja
rules:
Ursine Fylgja enters play with four healing counters on it.
Remove a healing counter from Ursine Fylgja: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to it this turn.
{Ws}: Put a healing counter on Ursine Fylgja.

name: Wall of Shards
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Defender} {Flying}

name: White Shield Crusader
rules:
{ProtectionB}`Protection from black`
{1s}: White Shield Crusader gains flying until end of turn.
{Ws}: White Shield Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Honor your steed and it will carry you far—and bring you home to tell of it.

name: Woolly Razorback
rules:
Woolly Razorback enters play with an ice counter on it. As long as Woolly Razorback has an ice counter on it, prevent all combat damage it would deal and it has defender.
Whenever Woolly Razorback blocks, remove an ice counter from it.

name: Adarkar Sentinel
rules:
{Wither}`Wither`
#Snow landfall# — Whenever a snow land enters play under your control, Adarkar Sentinel gets +1/+1 and gains vigilance until end of turn.
{1s}: Adarkar Sentinel gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Aegis of the Meek
rules: {1s}: Target creature with either power or toughness equal to 1 gets +3/+3 and gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
“With this marvel, even the weak have a fighting chance—enduring every blow and standing resolute when others fall.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Amulet of Quoz
rules:
{Tn}, Sacrifice Amulet of Quoz: Put the top two cards of target opponent’s library onto the stack or into play under your control.
{Tn}, Sacrifice Amulet of Quoz: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, take an extra turn after this one. If you lose, sacrifice a permanent.

name: Arcum's Sleigh
rules: {Tn}: Target creature gains haste and vigilance until end of turn. Activate only if there is a snow land in play.
flavor:
“With the proper equipment and caution, one can travel anywhere—even through icebound wastes where few dare tread, guided by the steady light of invention.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Arcum's Weathervane
rules:
{1s}, {Tn}: Target snow land is no longer snow.
{1s}, {Tn}: Target nonsnow land becomes snow.
flavor:
“If you can control the weather during an ice age, you control the entire world.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Arcum's Whistle
rules: {1s}, {Tn}: Target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn attacks this turn if able. At the next end step, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature if it attacked this turn, or destroy it if it didn’t. Activate only before attackers are declared.

name: Barbed Sextant
rules: {1s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Barbed Sextant: Add two mana of any one color. Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor: Legend has it the Skeleton Ship of Argoth can navigate the seas of Terisiare so well because of this device. However, nobody who has seen the legendary ship has ever returned to verify this information.

name: Baton of Morale
rules:
{2s}: Redirect any amount of damage dealt to a creature you control to another creature you control.
{Ss}: Target creature gains menace until end of turn.
flavor:
“Goblins would kill to get one of these.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Celestial Sword
rules: {Tn}: Target creature gets +6/+6 until end of turn. Its controller sacrifices it at the next end step.
flavor:
“So great is its power that only the bravest are chosen to wield it, and even they stand very little chance of mastering it.”
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Crown of the Ages
rules:
{2s}, {Tn}: Attach target Aura attached to a creature to another creature.
During your upkeep, for each artifact of the Ages in play, you may gain 1 life, untap target artifact you control, remove a poison counter from yourself, and remove a -1/-1 counter from target creature.

name: Despotic Scepter
rules:
{Tn}: Destroy target permanent you own. If it has indestructible, it loses that ability until end of turn. Put a death counter on Despotic Scepter. Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
{Tn}, Remove three death counters from Despotic Scepter: Return a permanent from your graveyard to play.

name: Elkin Bottle
rules:
{Indestructible}`Indestructible`
{1s}, {Tn}: Exile the top card of your library. Until your next upkeep, you may play that card.
{Ss}, {Tn}: Exile the top two cards of your library. Until your next upkeep, you may play those cards.

name: Fyndhorn Bow
rules: {Tn}: Target creature gains first strike and reach until end of turn.
flavor:
“With a bow like this, the hunt is always plentiful. In the hands of one who respects the wilds, it is more than a weapon—it carries the blessings of the forest and the wisdom of the Elvish generations past.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Goblin Lyre
rules: {Tn}: Flip a coin. You may pay {2s} to re-flip once. If you win the flip, Goblin Lyre deals damage to target opponent or a planeswalker they control equal to the number of creatures you control. If you lose the flip, Goblin Lyre deals damage to you equal to the number of creatures that opponent controls.

name: Hematite Talisman
rules: Whenever a player casts a black, red, or colorless spell, you may untap target permanent.
flavor:
“The crystalline heartbeat of ferric oxide pulses with force—its colors a spectrum of shifting hues between shadowed black, molten red, and weathered brown.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Ice Cauldron
rules:
{Xs}, {Tn}: If there are no cards exiled with Ice Cauldron, exile a nonland card from your hand. X equals any amount of mana you may pay towards the exiled card’s mana value.
{Ys}, {Tn}: Play the card currently exiled with Ice Cauldron. Y equals the exiled card’s remaining mana value.

name: Icy Manipulator
rules: {Tn}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor:
“The scavengers who first found it called it the ‘Bone Crank’. And now they’ve built an entire village around it. At dawn, the grinding echoes summon the living, and at dusk, it serves as a lullaby.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Infinite Hourglass
rules:
During your upkeep, put a time counter on Infinite Hourglass.
Creatures you control get +1/+0 for each time counter on Infinite Hourglass.
{4s}: Remove a time counter from Infinite Hourglass. Any player may activate this ability but only during their upkeep.

name: Jester's Cap
rules: {1s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Jester’s Cap: Search target player’s library for three cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.
flavor:
“They say the last owner of this cap cut out his own tongue, laughing the whole time. Superstitious drivel, but amusing, isn’t it?”
—Hilde the Collector, last known words

name: Jester's Mask
rules:
Jester’s Mask enters play tapped.
{1s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Jester’s Mask: Target opponent puts the cards from their hand on top of their library. Search that player’s library for that many cards. That player puts the chosen cards into their hand, then shuffles their library.

name: Jeweled Amulet
rules:
{1s}, {Tn}: Put a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet.
{Tn}, Remove all charge counters from Jeweled Amulet: Add one mana of any color for each removed charge counter.
flavor:
“A ghastly amulet on a ghastly woman.”
—Hilde the Collector

name: Lapis Lazuli Talisman
rules: Whenever a player casts a white, blue, or colorless spell, you may untap target permanent.
flavor:
“A crystalline feldspathoid silicate, its mesmerizing depths swirl with midnight blues and shining flecks of white pyrite— like a fragment stolen from the heavens.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Malachite Talisman
rules: Whenever a player casts a black, green, or colorless spell, you may untap target permanent.
flavor:
“Dark mammillary masses spiral in perfect concentric harmony, their vibrancy whispering secrets of ancient forests— nature’s pulse eternally caught in stone.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Nacre Talisman
rules: Whenever a player casts a white, black, or multicolor spell, you may untap target permanent.
flavor:
“Behold the radiant Mother-of-pearl. Its nacre weaves colors beyond mortal sight— sometimes as luminous as snow, at other times as shadowed as the heart of night.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Naked Singularity
rules:
You may draw from any library.
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {Rs}, Islands produce {Gs}, Swamps produce {Ws}, Mountains produce {Us}, and Forests produce {Bs} instead of any other type.
If a card named Reality Twist enters play, target player loses the game.

name: Onyx Talisman
rules: Whenever a player casts a black, red, or green spell, you may untap target permanent.
flavor:
“While we’ve encountered a few black ones, there was a variety of colors due to the presence of different mineral impurities within the cryptocrystalline structure.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Pentagram of the Ages
rules:
{1s}, {Tn}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
{1s}, {Tn}: Choose a target creature you control. Put a random ability token on it.
During your combat phase, prevent 1 damage to each creature you control for each artifact of the Ages in play.

name: Pit Trap
rules:
{1s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. If it has indestructible, exile it instead. Look at the top card of that creature’s controller’s library. You may put that card on the bottom of their library.
Sacrifice a land you control: Return Pit Trap from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Runed Arch
rules:
{1s}, {Tn}: Target creature with power 3 or less can’t be blocked this turn.
{Xs}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Runed Arch: X target creatures with power 3 or less can’t be blocked this turn.
flavor: Victory is forged by the unseen, whose steps pass unchallenged beneath the arch.

name: Shield of the Ages
rules:
Each turn, redirect the first X damage dealt to you to any target. X equals the number of artifacts of the Ages in play.
{1s}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
flavor: Legend has it there are five artifacts of the Ages, but only four have been found so far by the recent Soldevi expeditions.

name: Skull Catapult
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor:
“Let any who doubt the evil of using the ancient devices take a look at this infernal machine. What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic contraption?”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Snow Fortress
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`
{Ss}: Snow Fortress deals 1 damage to target creature without flying that’s attacking you.
{1s}: Snow Fortress gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Snow can be an ally or an enemy.

name: Soldevi Golem
rules:
Soldevi Golem doesn’t untap during your untap step.
During your upkeep, you may untap target tapped creature an opponent controls. If you do, untap Soldevi Golem.
flavor: Slow and steady wins every battle.

name: Soldevi Simulacrum
rules: {1s}: Soldevi Simulacrum gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
“They appear human—until dark ichor spills instead of blood, their eyes blaze with unnatural yellow fire, or their mechanical limbs strike with relentless, impossible force.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Staff of the Ages
rules:
Creatures with landwalk abilities can be blocked as though they didn’t have those abilities.
During your upkeep, Staff of the Ages deals 1 damage to any target for each artifact of the Ages in play.
{Ss}: Target creature can’t be blocked except by Walls until end of turn.

name: Sunstone
rules:
{1s}, Sacrifice a land: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
{Tn}, #Blizzard# — Exile Sunstone until end of turn: Basic lands you control are snow until end of turn.
flavor:
“I dispute Relicbane’s hysterical allegations, but these artifacts can be very dangerous.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Time Bomb
rules:
#Snow landfall# — Whenever a snow land enters play, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
During your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{Tn}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to all targets.

name: Urza's Bauble
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice Urza’s Bauble: Look at target player’s hand. You may choose a card and put it on the bottom of that player’s library. You draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“This cursed trinket whispers dark secrets about knowledge that breeds destruction.”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Vexing Arcanix
rules: {2s}, {Tn}: Target player names a card, then reveals the top card of their library. If it’s the named card, that player puts it into play. Otherwise, they put it into their graveyard and Vexing Arcanix deals 3 damage to that player.
flavor: Mysterious power of wishes and dreams.

name: Vibrating Sphere
rules:
During your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
During turns other than yours, creatures you control get +0/+2.
{Tn}, Sacrifice Vibrating Sphere: Until end of turn, creatures your opponents control get either -2/-0 or -0/-2.

name: Walking Wall
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`  {Haste}`Haste`
{3s}: Walking Wall gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn’t have defender.
flavor:
“The mountain is not what it seems.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Wall of Shields
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`
{0s}: Redirect any amount of damage dealt to any target to Wall of Shields.
flavor:
“Ouch! Shield wall very good at blocking big hits! But sneaky sharp bits always find their way right through the middle!”
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: War Chariot
rules:
{1s}, {Tn}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
{3s}, {Tn}: Target creature gains horsemanship until end of turn.
flavor:
“I just wouldn’t advise using this delicate machinery with a Woolly Mammoth.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Whalebone Glider
rules: {1s}, {Tn}: Target creature with toughness 3 or less gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
“I’ll be honest and say it straight—this isn’t an Ornithopter, and that’s fine. After all, I’m no Urza, and we can’t all craft wonders with the snap of a finger.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Zuran Orb
rules: Sacrifice a land: You gain 3 life. If you sacrificed a snow land, you gain 6 life instead.
flavor:
“Obsession is Zur’s one flaw as a magic user. His total preoccupation with immortality has become an affliction for his otherwise brilliant mind. Shame.”
—Jodah, Archmage Eternal

name: Abyssal Specter
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
flavor:
“It wields its ethereal axe to a chorus of whispers that are more felt than heard.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Ashen Ghoul
rules:
{Haste}`Haste`
{Bs}: Return Ashen Ghoul from your graveyard to play. Activate only during your upkeep and only if three or more cards are above it.
flavor: Flesh and beauty fade, but the hunger to strike again lasts beyond the grave.

name: Brine Shaman
rules:
{Tn}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
{Us}{Us}, Sacrifice a creature: Counter target creature spell.
flavor:
“Silently, the Shamans of Marit Lage obey her every call—with joy rather than fear.”
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Burnt Offering
rules:
As an additional cost to cast Burnt Offering, sacrifice a creature.
Add X mana in any combination of {Bs} and/or {Rs}, where X is the sacrificed creature’s mana value.
flavor:
“Foes serve me in dying and in death.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Cloak of Confusion
rules:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn’t blocked, you may have it assign no combat damage this turn.{BL} If you do, choose whether defending player discards a card at random, attacking player draws a card, or each player mills two cards.

name: Dance of the Dead
rules:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
Put enchanted creature to play tapped under your control and attach Dance of the Dead to it. Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and doesn’t untap during its controller’s untap step unless they pay {1s}{Bs}. When Dance of the Dead leaves play, sacrifice the creature.

name: Dark Banishing
rules: Destroy target nonblack creature. If it has indestructible, exile it instead.
flavor:
“Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither under the cold hand of midnight as despair’s chill takes hold.”
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

name: Dark Ritual
rules: Add {Bs}{Bs}{Bs}.
flavor:
“Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due, so that I may bind legions of the fallen into an unstoppable horde, forged from shadow and bone, to carry out thy dark will across these shattered lands.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Demonic Consultation
rules: Name a card. Exile the top six cards of your library, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card. Put that card into your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.
flavor: Is eternity’s price worth a moment’s power? A single wish, a lifetime lost. Still tempted?

name: Dread Wight
rules: At end of combat, put a paralyzation counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Dread Wight and tap those creatures. They don’t untap during its controller’s untap step if they have a paralyzation counter on them. Their controller may pay {6s} at any time to remove a paralyzation counter.

name: Drift of the Dead
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`
Drift of the Dead’s power and toughness are each equal to 3 plus the number of snow lands in play.
flavor:
“Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. They shall serve a new purpose.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Fear
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has fear and hexproof from nonblack colors.
flavor:
“Even the bravest warriors still feel the dark clutch of fright upon their stalwart hearts, as shadows close in silently.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Flow of Maggots
rules:
Flow of Maggots can’t be blocked by non-Wall creatures.
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Flow of Maggots.
flavor:
“It sounded like writhing of the damned.”
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Foul Familiar
rules:
Foul Familiar can’t block.
{0s}: Return Foul Familiar to its owner’s hand.
flavor:
“Serve me, and live forever—beyond the reach of death’s cold grasp, where your soul shall find a power none can resist.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Gangrenous Zombies
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
{Tn}, Sacrifice Gangrenous Zombies: Gangrenous Zombies deals 1 damage to each creature and each player, except if you control a snow Swamp, then Gangrenous Zombies deals 2 damage to each creature and each player instead.

name: Gaze of Pain
rules: Until end of turn, whenever a creature you control attacks and isn’t blocked, you may choose to have it deal damage equal to its power to a target creature. If you do, it assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: “My eyes search for light, but all I find are memories, rippling quietly on water.”

name: Gravebind
rules:
All creatures lose indestructible until end of turn. If any creature in play has protection from black, Gravebind is colorless this turn.
Creatures can’t enter play from graveyards this turn. Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.

name: Hecatomb
rules:
When Hecatomb enters play, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three creatures.
{Bs}: Hecatomb deals 2 damage to any target. If you control two or more snow lands, Hecatomb deals 3 damage to any target instead.
flavor: “Frost and flame demand their tribute.”

name: Hoar Shade
rules: {Bs}: Hoar Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
“The creature we fought in the western waste was mortally wounded, but it still rebounded and attacked again—driven by some dark force beyond death.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Howl from Beyond
rules: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“Carved from the breath of my servants, my voice shall spread like a creeping chill, seeping into the hearts of my enemies and stirring paralyzing terror in their veins.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Hyalopterous Lemure
rules:
{0s}: Hyalopterous Lemure gets -1/-0 and gains flying until end of turn.
{Tn}: Destroy X target Humans where X equals the number of Spirits you control. Sacrifice Hyalopterous Lemure at end of turn.
flavor: When they descend, little remains.

name: Icequake
rules:
Destroy target land. If that land was snow, Icequake deals 2 damage to that land’s controller.
{Flashback}`Flashback` {3s}
flavor:
“Only fools place faith in legions, while the ground itself is my greatest ally.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Infernal Darkness
rules:
During your upkeep, sacrifice Infernal Darkness unless you pay {Bs} and 1 life.
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces {Bs} instead of any other type.
flavor:
“I thought the day had brought enough horrors, but the night was far worse.”
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Infernal Denizen
rules:
{Fear}`Fear`
When Infernal Denizen leaves play target opponent may gain control of a creature you control of their choice.
{Tn}: Gain control of target creature for as long as Infernal Denizen remains in play.

name: Kjeldoran Dead
rules:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters play, sacrifice a creature.
{Bs}: Kjeldoran Dead gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor:
“They shall drink sorrow’s dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Knight of Stromgald
rules:
{Fear}`Fear`  {ProtectionW}`Protection from white`
{Bs}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{Bs}{Bs}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: “A shadowed blade strikes truer than a shining sword—without mercy.”

name: Krovikan Elementalist
rules:
{Rs}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{Us}: Target creature you control gains flying until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the next end step.
flavor: Legends tell of Elementalists being able to shape land with a single gesture.

name: Krovikan Fetish
rules:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish enters play, draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Sacrifice enchanted creature: Target creature gets +3/+3.

name: Krovikan Vampire
rules: If a creature dealt damage by Krovikan Vampire this turn died, put that card into play under your control. Sacrifice it when you lose control of Krovikan Vampire.
flavor: Preying on their victims outside the walls of Kjeldoran capital city of Krov.

name: Legions of Lim-Dul
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Menace} {Snowwalk} {Swampwalk}

name: Leshrac's Rite
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk and fear.
{Bs}: Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn.
{Bs}{Bs}: Target creature gains fear until end of turn.

name: Leshrac's Sigil
rules:
As Leshrac’s Sigil enters play, choose a color. Whenever an opponent casts a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {Bs}{Bs}. If you do, look at that player’s hand and choose a card from it. The player discards that card.
{Bs}{Bs}: Return Leshrac’s Sigil to its owner’s hand.

name: Lim-Dul's Cohort
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
Whenever Lim-Dûl’s Cohort blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature loses indestructible and hexproof until end of turn.
flavor:
“Join me where the dark waters weep.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Lim-Dul's Hex
rules:
During your upkeep, Lim-Dûl’s Hex deals 1 damage to each player unless they pay {Bs} or {3s}.
{Bs}{Bs}{Bs}: Lim-Dûl’s Hex deals 1 damage to each player unless they pay {Bs} or {3s}.
flavor: Only the strong shall remain standing.

name: Mind Ravel
rules:
Target player discards two cards. If that player has no cards in hand, they may draw a card.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“And so the fragile grasp of order collapses and the world resets in void’s embrace.”
—Tevesh Szat, Silent Death

name: Mind Warp
rules:
Look at target player’s hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards and loses X life.
You draw X cards and gain X life.
flavor: “Did someone just shuffle my memories? My brain feels like a snow globe, and someone just won’t stop shaking it.”

name: Mind Whip
rules:
Enchant creature
During its controller’s upkeep, enchanted creature deals 4 damage to that player and becomes tapped. Its controller may pay {4s} to prevent this.
flavor: Within the labyrinth of pain, memory strays, and flight is nothing but a myth.

name: Minion of Leshrac
rules:
{ProtectionB}`Protection from black`
During your upkeep, Minion of Leshrac deals 2 damage to you unless you sacrifice a creature other than Minion of Leshrac.
{Tn}: Destroy target creature or land.
flavor: The price of evil can never be paid.

name: Minion of Tevesh Szat
rules:
During your upkeep, Minion of Tevesh Szat deals 2 damage to you unless you pay {Bs}.
{Tn}: Target creature gets +4/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: None but Tevesh Szat could manage these demons with any real control.

name: Mole Worms
rules: {Tn}: Put a burrow counter on Mole Worms. Tap X target lands where X equals the number of burrow counters on Mole Worms. Lands tapped this way don’t untap during their controller’s next untap step.
flavor: Some secrets that thrive underground are better left unknown and unearthed.

name: Moor Fiend
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Swampwalk}

name: Necropotence
rules:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card instead.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at your next end step.
flavor: No more dead, no more burial grounds.

name: Norritt
rules:
{Tn}: Untap target blue creature.
{Tn}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. If it doesn’t, destroy it at the next end step. Activate this ability before attackers are declared.

name: Oath of Lim-Dul
rules:
Whenever you lose life, for each 1 life you lost, sacrifice a permanent other than Oath of Lim-Dûl or discard a card. If you can’t, you lose the game.
{Bs}: Draw a card.
flavor:
“Victory by any means necessary.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Pestilence Rats
rules: As Pestilence Rats enters play, choose a creature type. Pestilence Rats’ power is equal to the number of creatures of the chosen type in play.
flavor:
“They slip from every shadow, unending in their advance—nothing can bar their hunger or slow their countless feet.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Pox
rules: Each player loses a third of their life, then discards a third of the cards in their hand, then sacrifices a third of the creatures they control, and then sacrifices a third of the lands they control. Round up each time.
flavor: Lim-Dûl’s disease can run through an army and destroy its will to exist—let alone win.

name: Seizures
rules:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Seizures deals 3 damage to that creature’s controller unless that player pays {3s}.
flavor:
“Sheathe your sword or fall on it.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Songs of the Damned
rules: Add {Bs} for each creature card in your graveyard.
flavor:
“What you hear is not the wind, but the breath of the dead. Their whispers sing a warning etched upon the ice for those who would forget what the cold reaps—and yet we endure, for ice steels Balduvian hearts.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Soul Burn
rules:
Spend only {Bs} and/or {Rs} on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {Bs} spent on X.
flavor: By midnight’s shadow, the mind’s fire sparks—memories ignite, ablaze unseen.

name: Soul Kiss
rules:
Enchant creature
{Bs}, Pay 1 life: Enchanted creature gets +2/+3 until end of turn. Activate no more than three times each turn.
flavor:
“Love’s cruelty pales beside the void—yet still, I hunger for that forgotten light.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Spoils of Evil
rules: For each artifact or creature card in all graveyards, add {Cs} or {Ss}, you gain 1 life, and Spoils of Evil deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor:
“While virtue earns its due honors, the path that opposes it, dark as it may be, offers gains no less real or binding.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Spoils of War
rules: Distribute X +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures, where X equals the number of cards in a single or all graveyards. Distribute an additional -1/-1 counter for each {Ss} spent to pay for X.
flavor:
“Plundering—now, this is the fun part!”
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Stench of Evil
rules: Choose a basic land type. Destroy all lands of the chosen type. For each non-Plains destroyed this way, you lose 1 life. Stench of Evil deals 2 damage to the land’s controller for each Plains destroyed this way, and 1 damage for any other land.
flavor: Evil’s breath is worse than its touch.

name: Stromgald Cabal
rules:
{Tn}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
{Tn}, Pay 2 life: Counter target nonwhite spell.
flavor:
“Kjeldor must be supreme at any cost.”
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Touch of Death
rules:
Touch of Death deals 2 damage to any target. You gain 2 life.
Draw a card during next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your futile life.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Withering Wisps
rules:
At end of turn, if no creatures are in play, sacrifice Withering Wisps.
{Ss}: Withering Wisps deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
{1s}{Bs}: Withering Wisps deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: The palest light can cause the most harm.

name: Aurochs
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`  {Menace}`Menace`
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking creature.
flavor:
“One Auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it with inexorable force.”
—Oddveig Ulfsson, caravan scout

name: Balduvian Bears
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Mountainwalk} {Forestwalk}

name: Blizzard
rules:
Cast Blizzard only if you control a snow land.
Creatures with flying don’t untap during their controllers’ untap steps.
{Ss}: Blizzard deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor: When endless fury of snow cloaks the sky.

name: Brown Ouphe
rules: {Tn}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source.
flavor:
“Ouphes love trinkets and love to take them apart. I only wish they wouldn’t dissect the magical ones so carelessly.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Chub Toad
rules:
Whenever Chub Toad blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
{Ss}: Chub Toad gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only when it blocks or becomes blocked.
flavor:
“I’d roast it, but then it just gets bouncier.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Dire Wolves
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
Whenever Dire Wolves deals combat damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor:
“I would cross Terisiare alone, and keep no watch if I had a pack of greys like that hanging on my flanks as I went.”
—Oddveig Ulfsson, caravan scout

name: Earthlore
rules:
Enchant land you control
Tap enchanted land: Target blocking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Tap enchanted land: Add {Ss}.
flavor:
“Even the ground can be our friend.”
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of Fyndhorn

name: Elder Druid
rules:
{Tn}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
{Ws}, Tap a permanent you control: Tap or untap target permanent.
flavor:
“Did clouds dance in his eyes, did thorns play at his fingertips, or was he just lost?”
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard

name: Essence Filter
rules: Destroy all enchantments or all nonwhite enchantments. For each enchantment destroyed this way you may return a land card from any graveyard to play tapped under your control. Then draw a card for each enchantment still in play.
flavor:
“Let’s keep our newly given home pure.” 
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of Fyndhorn

name: Fanatical Fever
rules:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +8/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Two target creatures each get +4/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
{Flashback}`Flashback` {3s}
flavor: Let go of your fury, and hone your anger.

name: Folk of the Pines
rules:
Folk of the Pines can only be blocked by three or more creatures.
{Gs} or {Ss}: Folk of the Pines gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
“Our friends of the forest take many forms, yet all serve the will of Freyalise.”
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Forbidden Lore
rules:
Enchant land an opponent controls
You control enchanted land for as long as Forbidden Lore is in play. If enchanted land is snow, it becomes nonsnow and vice versa.
Enchanted land has “{Tn}: Target creature gets +3/+2 until end of turn.”

name: Forgotten Lore
rules:
Target opponent chooses up to three cards in your graveyard. Choose two of those cards and put them into your hand. Exile the remaining card.
Then choose up to three cards from that opponent’s graveyard. They choose and discard one of those cards and exile the other two.

name: Foxfire
rules:
Untap up to three target attacking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by those creatures this turn. If any of those creatures are snow, draw a card.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor: Only fools cower before Foxfire’s flame.

name: Freyalise Supplicant
rules:
{Lifelink}`Lifelink`
{Tn}, Sacrifice a creature: Freyalise Supplicant deals damage to any target equal to sacrificed creature’s power.
flavor:
“We have joined with the Druids of the Juniper Order. Our faith is now one.”
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Freyalise's Charm
rules:
As Freyalise’s Charm enters play, choose a color. Whenever an opponent casts a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {1s}{Gs}. If you do, draw a card and put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
{1s}{Gs}: Return Freyalise’s Charm to its owner’s hand.

name: Freyalise's Winds
rules:
Whenever a permanent becomes tapped, put a wind counter on it.
If a permanent with a wind counter on it would untap during its controller’s untap step, remove all wind counters from it instead.
{Gs}: Remove a wind counter.

name: Fyndhorn Brownie
rules:
{Tn}: Untap target creature.
{Gs}, {Tn}: Tap target creature.
flavor:
“I’ve been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted Brownies from Fyndhorn. Those clever tongues...”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Fyndhorn Elder
rules: {Tn}: Add two mana in any combination of {Gs} and/or {Ss}.
flavor:
“Anyone can speak to the trees. But to be able to listen to them like the eldest of the Elves can—that is truly wondrous.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Fyndhorn Elves
rules: {Tn}: Add {Gs}.
flavor:
“We could no more abandon the forest than the moons and stars could abandon the night sky—it would deny our very nature and the sacred trust we bear.”
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of Fyndhorn

name: Fyndhorn Pollen
rules:
All creatures get -2/-0.
{Gs}: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“I breathed deeply, and suddenly a wave of unfamiliarity washed over me—I no longer knew who or where I was.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Giant Growth
rules: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor:
“Here, the goddess Freyalise spreads her blessings like morning dew—each seed and each living creature grows strong and proud through her boundless generosity.”
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of Fyndhorn

name: Gorilla Pack
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
Gorilla Pack can’t attack unless defending player controls a Forest.
When you control no Forests, sacrifice Gorilla Pack.
flavor:
“Next time we’ll avoid Yavimaya forest.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Hot Springs
rules:
Enchant land you control
Enchanted land has “{1s}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. If the target is a snow creature, prevent the next 5 damage instead.”
flavor: Warmth breathes life, heat breathes peace.

name: Hurricane
rules: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
flavor:
“I have endured blizzards and darkness, but nothing compared to this storm. At first, wind howled like a thousand lost souls, but in its wake, all was scoured and silent, save for the pounding of my heart.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Johtull Wurm
rules: Whenever Johtull Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor:
“We must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we’re all dead.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Juniper Order Druid
rules: {Tn}: Untap target land. If it’s a snow land, add {Ss}.
flavor: “The once thriving towns of Kjeldor have grown plagued and filthy, unfit for any soul to call home. From this day forward, we pledge our lives to Fyndhorn forests, where hope and life still endure.”

name: Lhurgoyf
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
Lhurgoyf’s power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
flavor:
“Ach! Hans, run! It’s the Lhurgoyf!”
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

name: Lure
rules:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
flavor:
“No matter a mortal’s wisdom or strength, when Yavimaya beckons, her desires become the law for men and beasts alike.”
—Multani, Maro-Sorcerer of Yavimaya

name: Maddening Wind
rules:
Enchant creature
During the upkeep of enchanted creature’s controller, Maddening Wind deals 3 damage to that player.
flavor:
“A shifting wind moves through the forest. It is Freyalise, walking on the world.”
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of Fyndhorn

name: Nature's Lore
rules: Search your library for a land card that produces green mana and put it into play, then shuffle your library.
flavor:
“It is in our nature to recognize beauty, but to repeat it—that is another feat altogether not easily accomplished, demanding the tenderest touch of desire.”
—Hannah of Verdura

name: Pale Bears
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Menace} {Snowwalk} {Islandwalk}

name: Pygmy Allosaurus
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Snowwalk} {Forestwalk} {Swampwalk}

name: Pyknite
rules:
When Pyknite enters play, draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
{1s}{Gs}: Return Pyknite from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
“Watch your scalp if you irk a Pyknite.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Regeneration
rules: {Gs}, {Tn}: Return target creature that died this turn from your graveyard to play.
flavor:
“Freyalise has given me the gift, not the curse, of unprecedented longevity of life, to witness the growth of ancient forests.”
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Rime Dryad
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Snowwalk} {Hexproof}

name: Rime Dryad
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Snowwalk} {Hexproof}

name: Rime Dryad
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Snowwalk} {Hexproof}

name: Rime Dryad
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Snowwalk} {Hexproof}

name: Ritual of Subdual
rules: If a land is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
flavor:
“To defy Freyalise’s will is to invite ruin, for the unbending are broken by the relentless tide of her grace and power.”
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of Fyndhorn

name: Scaled Wurm
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Trample}

name: Shambling Strider
rules:
{Rs}{Gs}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{Tn}: Target land becomes snow until end of turn.
flavor: Freyalise forbids that any stranger should wander into the Striders’ territory.

name: Snowblind
rules: {Ss}, {Tn}: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn. If that creature is attacking, X equals the number of snow permanents defending player controls. Otherwise, X equals the number of snow permanents its controller controls.
flavor: Freyalise decides who may see the wonders of her forests and who may not.

name: Stampede
rules: Attacking creatures get +3/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor:
“We could see the horizon blacken with the great beasts, but it was too late by then. The icefield offered no immediate safety, but luckily most of us reached a crevasse in which we could take cover.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Stunted Growth
rules: Target player chooses three cards from their hand and puts them on top of their library in any order.
flavor:
“We came across a particularly bright species of moss and took a sample. We couldn’t imagine the side effects dissolved toxic metals inside it would cause.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Tarpan
rules: When Tarpan dies, you gain 4 life.
flavor:
“A good Tarpan is the mountain you stand on, and a bad one is the stone that cracks beneath you. Don’t gamble with their loyalty—your life depends on it, so tread very carefully in your choice.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Thermokarst
rules: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, you gain 4 life.
flavor:
“Finally, after all the ashes and ruins of our lost home, we have come to grasp the bitter truth—loss is not the final chapter, but a fertile ground for renewal’s dawn.”
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of Fyndhorn

name: Thoughtleech
rules: Whenever a basic land an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
flavor:
“A resourceful mage gathers secrets from ancient scrolls, but they pale beside the insights gleaned from the fears of your opponents—if you know how to watch.”
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Tinder Wall
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {Rs}{Rs}.
{Rs}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Tinder Wall deals 2 damage to target creature it’s blocking.
flavor: It’s the tinder on which you burn—fragile but poised to ignite an inferno.

name: Touch of Vitae
flavor: Freyalise is generous with her gifts of vitality and an eternal sense of renewal.

name: Trailblazer
rules: Up to four target creatures can’t be blocked this turn.
flavor:
“Our Elvish hunter Taaveti led us along hidden paths and we caught the Orcs from behind, completely by surprise.”
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Venomous Breath
flavor: Lizards have sharper breath than teeth.

name: Wall of Pine Needles
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`
{Gs}{Gs}: Return Wall of Pine Needles from your graveyard to play.
flavor: The forest reveals itself in a myriad of wonders—each form unique, and some more unexpected than others, reminding us of nature’s boundless creativity.

name: Whiteout
rules:
All creatures lose flying until end of turn.
{Ss}: Return Whiteout from your graveyard to your hand.
{Ss}{Ss}, Exile Whiteout from your hand: {BL}It deals 1 damage to each target. All creatures lose all abilities and their power becomes 0 until end of turn.

name: Wiitigo
rules:
Wiitigo enters play with eight +1/+1 counters on it.
During your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

name: Wild Growth
rules:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {Gs} in addition to the mana the land normally produces.
flavor: In Fyndhorn, where Freyalise’s power is strongest, the forest has its own rules.

name: Woolly Mammoths
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.
flavor:
“Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they’re certainly bad to fall off of! You better not underestimate their power.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Woolly Spider
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
“We need not fear the forces of the air. I’ve yet to see a spider without an appetite.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish hunter

name: Yavimaya Gnats
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {Indestructible}

name: Altar of Bone
rules:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for up to two creature cards, reveal them, then put them into your hand.
flavor:
“A small sacrifice for a great victory.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish hunter

name: Centaur Archer
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`
{Tn}: Centaur Archer deals 2 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor:
“Centaurs will kill our aesthir if they can—they’ve always been our enemies. Destroy these horse-people on sight.”
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Chromatic Armor
rules:
Enchant creature
When Chromatic Armor enters play, choose a color #(or colorless)#.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the last chosen color.
{1s}: Choose a new color #(or colorless)#.

name: Diabolic Vision
rules: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand, and each of the remaining cards either into your graveyard or on top of your library in any order.
flavor:
“I’ve seen my path. I won’t warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame.”
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Earthlink
rules:
Whenever a creature dies, that creature’s controller sacrifices a land. Put a life counter on Earthlink.
{Tn}, Sacrifice Earthlink: Return X creatures from any graveyard to play under your control where X equals the number of life counters on Earthlink.

name: Elemental Augury
rules:
{2s}: Look at the top three cards of target player’s library, then put them back in any order.
{2s}: Target player mills a card.
flavor:
“If you wish to unlock all mysteries, you may have to change your perceptions.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Essence Vortex
rules: Destroy target creature unless its controller pays life equal to its power and toughness combined. If the creature has indestructible, it loses that ability until end of turn.
flavor:
“Masters who sacrifice for servants will receive the gift of unwavering loyalty.”
—Journal, author unknown

name: Fiery Justice
rules: Fiery Justice deals 7 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets. Target opponent gains life equal to the number of targets you chose for Fiery Justice.
flavor:
“The fire of justice burns the hottest.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Fire Covenant
rules:
As an additional cost to cast Fire Covenant, pay X life.
Fire Covenant deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
flavor: The pact of ages, written in blood, sworn by the fury of fire and the silence of ice.

name: Flooded Woodlands
rules:
Green creatures can’t attack.
{Bs}, {Tn}: White creatures can’t attack until end of turn.
{Us}, {Tn}: Red creatures can’t attack until end of turn.
flavor: Freyalise’s tears bring life and renewal, but they also bring the winds of restless change.

name: Fumarole
rules:
As an additional cost to cast Fumarole, pay 2 life.
Destroy target creature and target land.
flavor:
“Too many have died in these fire pits.”
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

name: Ghostly Flame
rules:
Damage from black and/or red sources can’t be prevented. Black and red creatures have wither.
{1s}{Bs}: Until end of turn, target spell or permanent becomes black.
{1s}{Rs}: Until end of turn, target spell or permanent becomes red.

name: Giant Trapdoor Spider
rules: {1s}{Rs}{Gs}, {Tn}: Exile Giant Trapdoor Spider and target creature without flying that’s attacking you.
flavor:
“There is a terrible grace to its silence. To encounter such stillness in a creature so slender is a warning written in fear—an omen to better be heeded and avoided.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Glaciers
rules:
Plains, swamps, mountains, and forests you control are snow, and islands in addition to their other types.
As Glaciers enters play, tap all nonsnow lands. They do not untap during their controllers’ untap step unless they pay {1s} or tap a permanent for each such land.

name: Hymn of Rebirth
rules: Put target creature card from a graveyard into play under your control.
flavor:
“Though the snows still linger and sorrow may shadow the world, the gentle touch of spring remains undiminished. Soft rains will sing their songs, and with them, the endless circle of life awakens once more.”
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Kjeldoran Frostbeast
rules: At end of combat, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by Kjeldoran Frostbeast.
flavor:
“My warriors found that the creature was dangerous not only in combat, but also in simple proximity—an enemy not of steel, but something primal of shadow and cold.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Merieke Ri Berit
flavor: “You can keep your vows, but I prefer the moment you forget them.”
lore: Merieke Ri Berit drifted through Terisiare like a rumor given skin—beautiful, elusive, and never quite pinned to one truth. Some swore she was human, others whispered elf-blood, but everyone agreed on the same detail: she was a temptress whose sorcery turned wills into silk. Those who approached found their purpose quietly rewritten, their loyalties redirected with a smile that felt almost gentle. When her attention slipped away, what she left behind was not freedom, but ruin—proof that her “mercy” was simply a more elegant cruelty.
art: Merieke sits among broken stone as if it were a throne, wrapped in pale silk that clings like a whispered promise. Her beauty is calm and deliberate—soft features framed by flowing hair—yet the skulls at her side confess what her expression refuses to announce.

name: Monsoon
rules:
At each player’s end step, tap all untapped Plains, Islands, Swamps, and Forests that player controls and Monsoon deals 1 damage to the player for each land tapped this way.
As long as you control a Snow Mountain, prevent all damage dealt to you by Monsoon.

name: Mountain Titan
rules: Whenever you cast a black spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Mountain Titan.
flavor:
“The Titans claimed to draw strength from the rocks, but I suspect them of some darker allegiance—powers far beyond mere stone, whispers in the shadow that twist their might to unknown ends.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Reclamation
rules:
Black, red, and/or snow creatures can’t attack unless their controller sacrifices a land for each such creature they control that’s attacking.
Creatures you control assign combat damage equal to their toughness rather than their power. If they’re white, they also gain vigilance.

name: Skeleton Ship of Argoth
rules:
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Skeleton Ship of Argoth.
{Us}{Bs}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
flavor: The mysterious undead ship haunting the seas is said to dwell in the rocky shoals of the now ruined island of Argoth.
lore: The destruction of Argoth left more than splinters; it left a hunger in the waters that circle its rocky remains. Lim-Dûl’s name clings to those currents in sailors’ curses, and some claim the island’s dead were simply…recruited, lashed into a single floating omen. The ship does not raid with steel so much as with absence—an uncanny draining that makes strong arms feel suddenly brittle. In the story-halls of port towns, the warning is always the same: if the Skeleton Ship turns toward you, don’t pray for wind—pray for land.
art: A ghostly craft with skeletal ornamentation rides the channel beside jagged floes, its silhouette reading instantly as Argoth’s aftermath made mobile. The skull motif on the sail is almost polite—like a sign posted for those who still believe the sea is merely water. Light snow falls at the edges, but the real chill is the ship’s uncanny stillness.

name: Spectral Shield
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+3 and gains hexproof.
flavor:
“What can be a stronger shield than concealment? Have you ever defeated an enemy you didn’t know existed?”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Storm Spirit
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Tn}: Storm Spirit deals 3 damage to target creature.
flavor:
“I beseech thee, smite down our foes with the power of your lightning and thunder.”
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

name: Stormbind
rules: {1s}, Discard a card at random: Stormbind deals 3 damage divided among any targets.
flavor:
“The lightning answers only bare skin, unshielded by mortal fear. The unleashed roaring of thunder is not just weather—it is our birthright, ancient and raw.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Wings of Aesthir
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has flying and first strike.
flavor:
“For those who face the heavens without fear, the sky itself becomes not a barrier but a boundless realm without limits.”
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

name: Adarkar Wastes
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}.
{Tn}: Add {Ws} or {Us} and Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you. You may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{Tn}: Add {Ss}{Ss} and Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you. You may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Brushland
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}.
{Tn}: Add {Gs} or {Ws} and Brushland deals 1 damage to you. You may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{Tn}: Add {Ss}{Ss} and Brushland deals 1 damage to you. You may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Glacial Chasm
rules:
During your upkeep sacrifice Glacial Chasm unless you pay 2 life.
When Glacial Chasm enters play, sacrifice a land.
Creatures you control can’t attack.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.

name: Halls of Mist
rules:
Creatures that attacked during their controller’s last turn can’t attack.
{Tn}: Untap target artifact.
flavor: In the desolate frostbound keep, the hymns of oblivion wail, mingling with blood mists, waking cold iron sentinels, and ghostly flames that can’t be doused.

name: Ice Floe
rules:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap step.
{Tn}: Tap target creature without flying that’s attacking you. It doesn’t untap during its controller’s untap step for as long as Ice Floe remains tapped. When Ice Floe leaves play, destroy the creature currently tapped by it.

name: Karplusan Forest
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}.
{Tn}: Add {Rs} or {Gs} and Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you. You may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{Tn}: Add {Ss}{Ss} and Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you. You may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Land Cap
rules:
{Tn}: Add two mana in any combination of {Ws} or {Us}. Land Cap doesn’t untap during your next untap step.
While Land Cap is tapped, creatures you control can’t be blocked except by creatures with flying and horsemanship.

name: Lava Tubes
rules:
{Tn}: Add two mana in any combination of {Bs} or {Rs}. Lava Tubes doesn’t untap during your next untap step.
While Lava Tubes is tapped, creatures you control gain shadow and haste.
flavor: Fire forges harbingers of unstoppable fury.

name: River Delta
rules:
{Tn}: Add two mana in any combination of {Us} or {Bs}. River Delta doesn’t untap during your next untap step.
While River Delta is tapped, creatures you control gain fear and flash.
flavor: Where waters run dark, secrets can hide.

name: Sulfurous Springs
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}.
{Tn}: Add {Bs} or {Rs} and Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you. You may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{Tn}: Add {Ss}{Ss} and Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you. You may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Timberline Ridge
rules:
{Tn}: Add two mana in any combination of {Rs} or {Gs}. Timberline Ridge doesn’t untap during your next untap step.
While Timberline Ridge is tapped, creatures you control gain menace and trample.

name: Underground River
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}.
{Tn}: Add {Us} or {Bs} and Underground River deals 1 damage to you. You may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{Tn}: Add {Ss}{Ss} and Underground River deals 1 damage to you. You may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Veldt
rules:
{Tn}: Add two mana in any combination of {Gs} or {Ws}. Veldt doesn’t untap during your next untap step.
While Veldt is tapped, creatures you control can’t be blocked except by creatures with trample and vigilance.
flavor: The wild moves fast, don’t stay too long.

name: Aggression
rules:
Enchant non-Wall creature
Enchanted creature has first strike, vigilance, and trample.
At the end step of enchanted creature’s controller, destroy that creature if it didn’t attack this turn.
flavor: The brighter it burns, the sooner it is gone.

name: Anarchy
rules: Choose a color. Destroy all permanents of the chosen color. For each permanent destroyed this way, Anarchy deals 1 damage to you.
flavor:
“The Shaman’s staff cut through the air, and instantly the land convulsed with madness, as if gripped by a terrible fury.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Avalanche
rules:
Destroy X target lands.
Put a snow counter on X target nonsnow lands. Those lands become snow for as long as they have a snow counter on them.
flavor:
“Avalanche completely blocked the pass.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Balduvian Barbarians
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Menace}

name: Balduvian Hydra
rules:
Balduvian Hydra enters play with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from this card: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{1s}{Rs}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Balduvian Hydra.

name: Barbarian Guides
rules:
{Snowwalk}`Snow landwalk`
{1s}{Rs}, {Tn}: Target creature you control gains snow landwalk until end of turn. Return that creature to its owner’s hand at the next end step.
flavor: They will lead you anywhere, even to the bitterly cold top of Raynor Glacier.

name: Battle Frenzy
rules: Choose a color. Creatures of the chosen color you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Creatures not of the chosen color you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“One day we shall drink the blood of our foes. It is something to look forward to.”
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Bone Shaman
rules:
{Bs}, {Tn}: Target creature loses indestructible until end of turn.
{Tn}: Target player mills a card.
{Ss}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Bone Shaman: Return target creature from a graveyard to play under your control.
flavor: “Your bones will rattle no more.”

name: Brand of Ill Omen
rules:
Enchant creature
During your upkeep, sacrifice Brand of Ill Omen unless you pay {Rs}.
Enchanted creature’s controller can’t cast creature spells.
flavor:
“Those with the brand receive no comforts.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Chaos Lord
rules:
{FirstStrike}`First strike`  {Trample}`Trample`  {Haste}`Haste`
During your upkeep, target opponent gains control of Chaos Lord until your next upkeep if the number of permanents in play is even.
Chaos Lord gains double strike when it’s under its owner’s control.

name: Chaos Moon
rules: During each upkeep, count the number of permanents. If the number is odd, until end of turn, red creatures get +2/+2 and Mountains produce an additional {Rs}{Rs}. If the number is even, until end of turn, red creatures get -1/-1 and Mountains produce colorless mana instead of any other type.

name: Conquer
rules:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
Whenever enchanted land taps for mana, add an additional {Rs}, and Conquer deals 1 damage to that land’s owner.
{2s}{Rs}: Destroy enchanted land.
{0s}: Return Conquer to its owner’s hand.

name: Curse of Marit Lage
rules: As Curse of Marit Lage enters play, choose a basic land type. Tap all lands of the chosen type. They don’t untap during their controllers’ untap steps.
flavor:
“Our world has not felt her thundering flaps in lifetimes, but Marit Lage’s devastating presence is still with us.”
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Dwarven Armory
rules: Sacrifice a land: Distribute two +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.
flavor:
“Few of us left, now. Confounded Yeti have opened all the vents. We’d best hide here with these battle-tempered weapons.”
—Perena Deepcutter, Dwarven Armorer

name: Errantry
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0 and can only attack alone.
flavor:
“There is no shame in solitude. The lone Knight may succeed where an army of hundreds or even thousands founders.”
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Flame Spirit
rules: {Rs}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
“The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change. Whenever it would appear, the land would never be the same again.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Flare
rules:
Use only nonsnow mana to pay for Flare.
Choose up to four different targets. Flare deals 1 damage to each target. Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“Magic is a blast—sometimes literally.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Game of Chaos
rules: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 1 life and target opponent loses 1 life, and you decide whether to flip again. If you lose the flip, you may pay {Rs} to re-flip. Otherwise, you lose 1 life and the opponent gains 1 life and decides whether to flip again. Double the life stakes with each level.

name: Glacial Crevasses
rules: Sacrifice or discard a snow permanent: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you, your creatures, and/or your planeswalkers this turn.
flavor:
“The ridge above us suddenly crumbled. I can’t believe it was mere coincidence.”
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Goblin Mutant
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Trample}`Trample`
Goblin Mutant can’t attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 4 or greater.
Goblin Mutant can’t block creatures with power 4 or greater.
flavor: If only it had more inside its head.

name: Goblin Sappers
rules:
{Tn}: Target creature you control can’t be blocked this turn. Destroy it and Goblin Sappers at end of combat.
{Rs}{Rs}, {Tn}: Target creature you control can’t be blocked this turn. Destroy it at end of combat.
flavor: “Do not run! We are your friends!”

name: Goblin Ski Patrol
rules: {Ss}{Rs}: Goblin Ski Patrol gets +2/+0 and gains flying. Sacrifice it at the next end step.
flavor:
“I wonder what’s that shiny thing at the bottom of this cliff... AIIIEEEE!”
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician, {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} famous last words

name: Goblin Snowman
rules:
Whenever Goblin Snowman blocks, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.
{Ss}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature.
flavor:
“Strength in numbers? Right.”
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Grizzled Wolverine
rules: {Rs}: Grizzled Wolverine gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate only if Grizzled Wolverine is being blocked.
flavor:
“Before you release a Wolverine from the trap, better make sure it’s really dead.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Imposing Visage
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has menace.
{Rs}: Return Imposing Visage to its owner’s hand.
flavor: With the horrible mask, Lagfrak the Low terrorized the countryside. But then he would meet Il-Chunt, the mask’s model...

name: Incinerate
rules: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way has indestructible, it loses that ability until end of turn.
flavor:
“Roasted? Toasted? Maybe you want it rare? No? Well, let’s do it properly then—not just burned, but Jaya-done!”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Jokulhlaups
rules: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. If any of them have indestructible, they lose that ability until end of turn.
flavor:
“I was shocked when I first saw the aftermath of the disaster. The raging river had swept away trees, bridges, houses...”
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Karplusan Giant
rules:
Karplusan Giant gets +2/+2 for each tapped snow land you control.
Sacrifice Karplusan Giant: Opponent sacrifices target snow permanent.
flavor:
“They certainly aren’t the quickest, but they are the ‘coolest’ of Giants.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Karplusan Yeti
rules: {Tn}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. Then that creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.
flavor:
“What’s that smell? That can’t be good.”
—Perena Deepcutter, Dwarven Armorer

name: Lava Burst
rules: Lava Burst deals X damage to any target. If Lava Burst would deal damage to a creature, that damage can’t be prevented or dealt instead to another permanent or player.
flavor:
“Overkill? Not if you want to make sure there’s nothing left! Erase. Every. Trace.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Marton Stromgald
rules:
{Horsemanship}`Horsemanship`
Whenever Márton attacks, other attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each attacking creature other than Márton. Whenever Márton blocks, other blocking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each blocking creature other than Márton.
flavor: “Keep your line. Keep your nerve. The cold only wins when we start believing it.”
lore: Márton Stromgald was Kjeldor’s towering war-hero—an iron-handed commander whose charge could make a scattered line feel like a single blade. When he led Lim-Dûl’s squadron into disaster, the necromancer kept one survivor and stole one legacy, reanimating Márton to found the Order of Stromgald. Even trapped inside his own body, Márton’s presence still drew soldiers into motion, turning fear into formation. In Tresserhorn’s shadow, Jodah saw the truth: a legend forced to march for an enemy who hated him.
