art: Márton is shown the way Kjeldor first loved him: a mounted commander in a red cloak, sword extended not in fury but in direction. The landscape frames him like a rallying point, as if the world itself is falling into formation around his ride.

name: Melee
rules:
Cast Melee only during combat on your turn before blockers are declared.
You choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block. Whenever a creature attacks and isn’t blocked this combat, untap it and remove it from combat.
flavor: “We are twice armed if we fight close.”

name: Melting
rules:
All snow lands are no longer snow.
During each player’s upkeep, destroy all lands with two flood counters on them.
{Rs}, {Tn}: Put a flood counter on target land that can’t produce blue mana.
flavor:
“And when the sun sets, I’ll take over.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Meteor Shower
rules: Meteor Shower deals X plus 2 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets. If X is zero, you are one of the targets.
flavor:
“Why settle for one winner when you can scorch the crowd? It’s not about winning, it’s about going out with a bang.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Mountain Goat
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Mountainwalk} {Haste}

name: Mudslide
rules:
Creatures without flying don’t untap during their controllers’ untap steps. During each player’s upkeep, that player may pay {3s} for each creature without flying to untap it.
{Tn}: Two target creatures with flying both lose flying until end of turn. One of them must be under your control.

name: Orcish Cannoneers
rules: {Tn}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 3 damage to any target and 2 damage to you.
flavor:
“It’s a thankless job, and you’ll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is well above average—hazard bonus included.”
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Orcish Conscripts
rules:
Orcish Conscripts can’t attack or block alone.
Sacrifice a creature: Orcish Conscripts can attack or block alone this turn, and gets +X/+Y where X/Y equals the sacrificed creature’s power and toughness until end of turn.

name: Orcish Farmer
rules: {Rs}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller’s next untap step.
flavor:
“There is no natural disaster quite like orcish farming. It is as if the landscape suffered the fiercest storm in history.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Orcish Healer
rules:
{Rs}, {Tn}: Target creature loses all abilities until end of turn.
{Bs}{Rs}, {Tn}: Target black or red creature gains indestructible until end of turn.
{Rs}{Gs}, {Tn}: Target red or green creature gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: “What? You wanted less pain?”

name: Orcish Healer
rules:
{Rs}, {Tn}: Target creature loses all abilities until end of turn.
{Bs}{Rs}, {Tn}: Target black or red creature gains indestructible until end of turn.
{Rs}{Gs}, {Tn}: Target red or green creature gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: “What? Orc females aren’t shy.”

name: Orcish Librarian
rules: {Rs}, {Tn}: Look at the top six cards of your library. Exile one of them at random, then put one into your hand, and the rest on top of your library in any order.
flavor: “Hey, at least I’m trying to learn how to read. My father thought books were just food, nothing but tasty morsels.”

name: Orcish Lumberjack
rules: {Tn}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {Rs} and/or {Gs}.
flavor: “How did I ever let myself get talked into this? Everyone knows wood is better wasted in the dirt—it’s not like stacking logs ever did anyone any good.”

name: Orcish Squatters
rules: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn’t blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: Settling on neighboring land has always been one of Orcish favorite pastimes.

name: Panic
rules:
Cast Panic only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can’t block this turn.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“Hey, don’t judge me—anyone would’ve hightailed it when that deer showed up!”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Pyroblast
rules:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it’s blue or shares a color with a card revealed from your hand.
• Destroy target permanent if it’s blue or shares a color with a permanent you control.

name: Pyroclasm
rules: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
flavor:
“This way there will be more room for the big ones that everyone wants to see.{BL2} Sure, the small ones are cute, but that’s not what draws a crowd, you know.” 
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Sabretooth Tiger
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {FirstStrike} {Forestwalk}

name: Shatter
rules: Destroy target artifact.
flavor:
“Some wounds are too deep to heal, and some memories too fierce to face. We must shatter the relics that unleashed our doom long ago, lest they rise again to claim us all. But I guess it’s all in vain, isn’t it?”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Stone Rain
rules: Destroy target land.
flavor:
“May the forces that plunged the lush forests of Argoth beneath the waves never return to claim our home again. Their overwhelming power serves as a solemn warning against the fragility of nature.”
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Stone Spirit
rules:
Stone Spirit can’t be blocked by creatures with flying.
{1s}{Rs}, Sacrifice Stone Spirit: Destroy all creatures with flying.
flavor:
“Nothing with wings can cross its path.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Stonehands
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+4.
{Rs}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong, it shatters swords, it breaks bones.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Tor Giant
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Snowwalk}

name: Total War
rules:
Whenever a player attacks with one or more creatures, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn’t attack, except for creatures the player hasn’t controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn.
{Tn}: Target non-Wall creature attacks this turn if able.

name: Vertigo
rules: Vertigo deals 4 damage divided as you choose between any number of creatures with flying. They lose flying until end of turn.
flavor:
“I saw the wizard below waving his staff, but I didn’t realize his scheme until my Aesthir cried out and went into a dive.”
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Wall of Lava
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`
{Rs}: Wall of Lava gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
“A wall of lava? Well, well, this sight’s got some serious power—and I like that. Don’t blink, or you’ll miss the scorch.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Word of Blasting
rules: Destroy all Walls. If any of them have indestructible, they lose that ability until end of turn. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to each Wall’s toughness to that Wall’s controller.
flavor:
“Walls? What walls? I just see rubble.”
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Arnjlot's Ascent
rules: {1s}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor:
“The dreams of a child fulfilled—the wind on my brow, the air underneath my feet. No heights are unattainable, and every gust carries the promise of new horizons.”
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

name: Balduvian Conjurer
rules: {Tn}: Target snow land becomes a 3/3 creature until end of turn. It’s still a land.
flavor: “Balduvia’s land is more than stone and snow—it listens to our courage. The cold shapes itself into icy sentinels that rise and march with the living. Together, we defend our own with silent fury.”

name: Balduvian Shaman
rules: {Tn}: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another until end of turn.
flavor: “Spirits of the ever-shifting winds of change, I call you forth—from the frozen peaks to the burning sands, carry my voice beyond the endless skies.”

name: Binding Grasp
rules:
Enchant creature
During your upkeep, sacrifice Binding Grasp unless you pay {Us}.
You control enchanted creature. Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
flavor:
“What I want, I take, no questions.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Brainstorm
rules: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
flavor:
“I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Breath of Dreams
rules: As Breath of Dreams enters play, choose a color. Spells and activated abilities of the chosen color cost {1s} plus one mana of that color more to cast and/or activate.
flavor:
“Get up, blast you! They’re attacking! Why are you all so slow waking up?”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Clairvoyance
rules: Target opponent reveals their hand. Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep for each color of cards revealed this way.
flavor:
“As we followed the ice wall, we had the distinct feeling of being watched. Many of the party wanted to turn back.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Counterspell
rules: Counter target spell.
flavor:
“The duel was turning against me, {BL2} and Zur was convinced I was done for.{BL2} I needed a distraction—so naturally, {BL} I relied on my feminine charms.{BL2} {BL2} From there, victory followed effortlessly.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Counterspell
rules: Counter target spell.
flavor:
“The duel turned dangerous, and Zur clearly thought I was his for the taking. I let my eyes linger, and as my robe parted with an inviting promise, I whispered a tease— with a simple spell the game was suddenly mine, and so was he, if I wished.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Deflection
rules:
You may choose new targets for target spell or activated ability.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“They tried to break me, so I broke them back. If you can’t teach them by word, teach them by steel. Lesson for lesson.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Dreams of the Dead
rules: {1s}{Us}{Us}: Return target white or black creature card from your graveyard to play. If the creature would leave play, exile it instead.
flavor: Between dusk and dawn, no deal is too strange—life lends a hand to the bold, and death pretends not to notice.

name: Enervate
rules:
Tap target permanent.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“The cosmos bends to those who dare to claim their moments. Every choice you make seduces destiny itself—so choose with intention, or be forever undone.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Errant Minion
rules:
Enchant creature
During their upkeep, Errant Minion deals 3 damage to enchanted creature’s controller. That player may pay {Ss}{Ss} to prevent this damage.
flavor: When doubt creeps like a shade, remember that faith is the ember that burns brightest.

name: Essence Flare
rules:
{Flash}`Flash`
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +5/+0. During the upkeep of enchanted creature’s controller, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor: Never underestimate the power of a soul.

name: Force Void
rules:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“Wrapped in my crystal sanctuary, {BL2} {BL2} I beckon you closer—try to pierce my mind barrier, darling. I promise, you’ll only find yourself burning for more.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Glacial Wall
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Defender}

name: Hydroblast
rules:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it’s red or green.
• Destroy target permanent if it’s red or white.
flavor:
“The forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Iceberg
rules:
Iceberg enters play with X plus 2 ice counters on it.
{2s}: Put an ice counter on Iceberg.
Remove an ice counter from Iceberg: Add {Us} or {Ss}.
flavor: The iceberg rewards those bold enough to draw near and brush its icy grandeur.

name: Icy Prison
rules:
When Icy Prison enters play, exile target creature.
During your upkeep, sacrifice Icy Prison unless you pay {1s}.
When Icy Prison leaves play, return the exiled card to play under its owner’s control.

name: Illusionary Forces
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
Whenever Illusionary Forces attacks, reveal your hand.
flavor:
“This school was founded in secret, operates in secret, and exists for the teaching of secrets. Those who would alter reality must first unravel its perception and escape it.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Illusionary Presence
rules: During your upkeep, choose a land type. Illusionary Presence gains landwalk of the chosen type until end of turn.
flavor:
“The presence of the ethereal being pressed upon us, as inescapable as the brewing storm’s thunder that shook the skies.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Illusionary Terrain
rules: Basic lands of one type become basic lands of another type of your choice.
flavor:
“We saw a sapphire lake and a circle of volcanic mountains. But we felt the suspicion that every rock and every ripple might vanish at a second glance—with map and mind equally unreliable.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Illusionary Wall
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {FirstStrike} {Defender}

name: Illusions of Grandeur
rules:
When Illusions of Grandeur enters play, you gain 20 life.
When Illusions of Grandeur leaves play, you lose 20 life.
flavor: To believe yourself invincible is to build castles on shifting sands—eventually, the tide will rise and sweep all illusions away.

name: Infuse
rules:
Untap up to two target permanents.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“The potential for change lies in all things. Know a thing’s nature, know its possibilities, and know it anew.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Krovikan Sorcerer
rules:
{Tn}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{Tn}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.
flavor:
“These cunning Sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves.”
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Magus of the Unseen
rules: {1s}{Us}, {Tn}: Gain control of target snow permanent or artifact an opponent controls until end of turn. If it’s tapped, untap it. It gains haste until end of turn. If it’s a creature, it can’t be blocked except by Walls and creatures with Horsemanship. When you lose control of it, tap it.

name: Mesmeric Trance
rules:
{Us}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
{Tn}, Sacrifice Mesmeric Trance: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
flavor:
“To wield magic endlessly is to freeze possibility itself. Wisdom lies in creativity and invention, not in cold repetition.”
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Mistfolk
rules: {Us}: Counter target spell that targets Mistfolk.
flavor:
“Although my official log will state there     is no conclusive evidence pointing to the existence of the Mistfolk, my certainty is lessened by the cursed consistency of the expedition’s eyewitness accounts.”
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Musician
rules:
{Us}: Put a music counter on target creature.
During every upkeep, destroy each creature the active player controls that has music counters on it unless that player pays {1s} for each music counter.
flavor: When you hear her flute, run!

name: Mystic Might
rules:
Enchant basic land or creature you control
When tapped, enchanted land produces an additional mana of an allied color of your choice.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.
flavor: Mist Moon is a rare empowering sight.

name: Mystic Remora
rules:
During your upkeep, sacrifice Mystic Remora unless you pay {1s}.
Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {4s}.
flavor: Remoras with their strong bonds are a favorite familiar among Kjeldoran mages.

name: Phantasmal Mount
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Tn}: Target creature you control with toughness 3 or less gets +2/+2 and gains flying and horsemanship until end of turn. When Phantasmal Mount leaves play this turn, sacrifice that creature, and vice versa.

name: Polar Kraken
rules:
{Trample}`Trample`
#Snow landfall# — Whenever a snow land enters play, Polar Kraken deals 4 damage to each creature an opponent controls.
Polar Kraken enters play tapped if you control no snow lands. {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} During your upkeep, tap Polar Kraken unless you sacrifice a land.

name: Portent
rules:
Look at the top three cards of target player’s library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle their library.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor: To see the celestial judgment that lies ahead is to hold tomorrow’s power in your hand.

name: Power Sink
rules: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {Xs}. If that player doesn’t, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.
flavor: Not all planeswalkers can consistently maintain a stable portal between planes— sometimes with devastating consequences.

name: Ray of Command
rules: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste and shadow until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
flavor: In the wizard’s grasp, beams of power cut through doubt like sun through clouds— the battle’s allegiance shifts in a heartbeat.

name: Ray of Erasure
flavor:
“Not all that fades is lost to darkness— some things are simply blinded by light.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Reality Twist
rules:
Blue spells cost {1s} less to cast.
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {Rs}, Swamps produce {Gs}, Mountains produce {Ws}, and Forests produce {Bs} instead of any other type.
If a card named Naked Singularity enters play, you lose the game.

name: Sea Spirit
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{Us}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor:
“It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. Even though it was beautiful, nothing could frighten me more.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Shyft
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
During your upkeep, you may have Shyft become the color or colors of your choice.
flavor:
“Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well to learn about versatility.”
—Gerda, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Sibilant Spirit
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
flavor:
“Relax, my friends. I’m sure it’s just a snake hissing or the wind whistling.”
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Silver Erne
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {Trample}

name: Sleight of Mind
flavor: Your expectations are the easiest to fool.

name: Snow Devil
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying. If you control a snow land, it also has first strike and haste.
flavor:
“Give me wings to fly and speed to strike. In return, the glory I earn shall be yours.”
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

name: Snowfall
rules: Whenever an Island is tapped for mana, its controller may add an additional {Us}. If that Island is snow, its controller may add an additional {Us}{Us} instead.
flavor:
“Our shelter is usually wherever we fall, but this storm never grants rest. In such endless snowfall, only restless will survive.”
— Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Soldevi Machinist
rules: {Tn}: Add {Cs}{Cs}{Cs}{Ss}. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifacts.
flavor:
“The march of progress demands patience. The artificer’s true strength grows not in reckless haste, but in measured thought.”
— Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Soul Barrier
rules: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to that player. They may pay {3s} to prevent that damage.
flavor:
“Magic is pleasure and pain entwined— summon as much as you wish, but you’ll feel every pulse of my vehemence.”
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Mage

name: Thunder Wall
rules:
{Defender}`Defender`  {Flying}`Flying`
{Us}: Thunder Wall gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
“The Lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The little beasts wavered and crashed to the earth.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Updraft
rules:
Target creature gains flying and haste until end of turn.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“The power of flight and the element of surprise. Knowing how to combine them on the battlefield is the key to victory.”
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

name: Wind Spirit
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {Menace}

name: Winter's Chill
rules:
Cast Winter’s Chill only during combat before blockers are declared. X can only be paid with {Ss}.
Destroy X target attacking creatures at end of combat unless their controller pays {3s} for each creature.
flavor: Nothing burns like the winter’s breath.

name: Word of Undoing
rules:
Return target creature and all Auras you own attached to it to their owners’ hands.
{Flashback}`Flashback` {2s}
flavor:
“It was in Urza’s journals where I found the secret at the core of the summonings.”
—Journal, author unknown

name: Wrath of Marit Lage
rules: As Wrath of Marit Lage enters play, choose a color. Tap all creatures of the chosen color. They don’t untap during their controllers’ untap steps.
flavor: Dread Marit Lage lies dreaming, not dead, deep beneath volcanic ice, where frozen fires scorch the unwary and drain their warmth to fuel her endless slumber.

name: Zuran Enchanter
rules: {Bs}, {Tn}: Target player discards a card. Activate only during your turn.
flavor:
“My enchanters and I have turned our backs on Kjeldor’s fading light. We have travelled to the chilling expanse of the Frost Marsh and the foreboding Black Spire that now marks our new dominion.”
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Zuran Spellcaster
rules: {Tn}: Zuran Spellcaster deals 1 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage by Zuran Spellcaster this turn leaves play, untap Zuran Spellcaster.
flavor:
“In the heights of our Black Spire I teach my mages to be precise as well as potent; cautious, as well as clever—like myself.”
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Zur's Weirding
rules:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If an opponent would draw a card, they reveal it first. Then you may pay 2 life. If you do, put that card into its owner’s graveyard.
flavor: “I orchestrate invisible threads that unravel my foes—so I don’t need to control them.”

name: Adarkar Unicorn
rules:
{Vigilance}`Vigilance`
As long as you control another snow creature, Adarkar Unicorn has lifelink.
{Tn}: Add {Us}{Us} or {Cs}{Cs}{Us}. Spend this mana only to pay for creature spells and/or activated abilities of creatures.
flavor: The noblest creature in Terisiare.

name: Arctic Foxes
rules: Arctic Foxes can’t be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater as long as defending player controls a snow land.
flavor:
“They are wily, swift, and ferocious. That’s why we call them the warriors of Terisiare’s snow plains and steppes.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Arenson's Aura
rules:
{Ws}, Sacrifice a permanent: Destroy target enchantment or artifact.
{1s}{Us}{Us}: Counter target enchantment or artifact spell.
flavor:
“It will cloak them in mystery and hide their names from their enemies.”
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Armor of Faith
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
{1s}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: “Keep your chainmail, warrior. I have my own form of protection. Plus, it works wonders distracting the enemy.”

name: Battle Cry
rules:
Untap all creatures you control. They gain trample until end of turn.
Whenever a creature blocks this turn, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
“With good morale and your wits about you half the battle is already won.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Black Scarab
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has ward {Bs} and can’t be blocked by black creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 as long as there’s a black permanent in play.
flavor: Scarab gems were brought to Dominaria by a mysterious visitor from Rabiah.

name: Blessed Wine
rules:
You gain 5 life.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor: “Sit with me. May the bounty of Kjeld{BL2} fill your hearth with warmth, and your nights with peace. In the long dark, generosity becomes our greatest lamp.”

name: Blinking Spirit
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
{0s}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner’s hand. You gain 4 life.
flavor:
“There it is, go after it—no, wait! It’s gone... Ah, there it is again, quick, go after it—no, wait! Aaarrggh, let’s not look at it. Maybe it will go away...”
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Blue Scarab
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has ward {Us} and can’t be blocked by blue creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 as long as there’s a blue permanent in play.
flavor: It is believed scarab gems once belonged to Fatima, a planeswalker from Rabiah.

name: Call to Arms
rules:
As Call to Arms enters play, choose a color.
Creatures you control get +2/+2 as long as the chosen color is the most common color among permanents in play.
{1s}{Ws}: Choose a different color.

name: Caribou Range
rules:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is snow and has {BL}{BL} “{Tn}: Add any amount of mana of any colors this land can produce. Spend this mana only to pay for snow spells.”
{1s}{Ws}, Sacrifice enchanted land: Gain control of target snow land.

name: Circle of Protection: Black
Circle of Protection: Blue
Circle of Protection: Green
Circle of Protection: Red
Circle of Protection: White
Cold Snap
rules: During each player’s upkeep, Cold Snap deals damage to that player equal to the number of snow lands they control, or the number of non-land snow permanents they control, whichever is higher, but no more than 4 damage.
flavor: Who knows from where the winter comes?

name: Cooperation
rules:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, it gains up to three target abilities of other attacking creatures.
flavor:
“The Elves train our healers, and we keep the Orcs at bay. It’s only fair.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Death Ward
rules:
Target creature gains indestructible and hexproof until end of turn.
You gain 2 life.
flavor:
“Sometimes, a soul is not ready to move on, so it lingers, weighed down by regrets, seeking peace before its final passage.”
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Disenchant
rules: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor:
“The horrors of history come not to rest by will alone. Like an ancient sword is sundered by bolts from the heavens, so too would the world be torn apart if we dare strike the first blow once more.”
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Drought
rules: As Drought enters play, choose a color. Spells of the chosen color cannot be cast and activated abilities requiring mana of that color cannot be activated unless the active player sacrifices a land for each such spell and/or activated ability.
flavor: Where once rivers danced in every shade, now drought’s shadow fell across the world.

name: Elvish Healer
rules: {Tn}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. If the target is a green or white creature, prevent all damage instead.
flavor:
“The Kjeldorans keep the Orcs at bay and we train their healers. Most other Human bargains aren’t as fair.”
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Enduring Renewal
rules:
If you would draw a creature card, put it into your graveyard, then draw a card.
If a creature is put into your graveyard from play, return it to your hand.
flavor: “A legacy is not born in haste, but through faithful years. Those of us, who remain, shape the world by simply being.”

name: Energy Storm
rules:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by instant and sorcery spells.
Creatures with flying don’t untap during their controllers’ untap steps.
flavor: Thunder shatters silence and lightning scars the earth, yet for every bolt that falls, the spirit of endurance stands unbroken.

name: Formation
rules:
This turn, you decide which creatures attack and block, and how combat damage is assigned.
Draw a card at the next end step for each creature that died this turn.
flavor:
“Each generation of Kjeldorans teaches me new tricks. There can be no better allies.”
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Fylgja
rules:
Enchant creature
Fylgja enters play with five healing counters on it.
Remove a healing counter from Fylgja: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature this turn.
{Ws}: Put a healing counter on Fylgja.

name: General Jarkeld
rules: {Tn}: Choose two target blocked attacking creatures. As long as they are still legal blockers, switch all blocking creatures between the two attacking creatures. Activate only during the declare blockers step.
flavor: Known as ‘Arctic Fox’, he was responsible for Kjeldor’s tactical brilliance.
lore: Jarkeld fought as though the battlefield were a board only he could see, where threats were rearranged with a glance and panic was shepherded into harmless corners. He trained with Fyndhorn elves not to become gentler, but to become exact—every step measured, every opening anticipated. His disappearance in the Adarkar Wastes left only stories and a missing banner, preserved as a formal saga in Krov’s Royal Academy. When Jodah raised an illusion of Jarkeld to lift Kjeldoran morale, it wasn’t deceit—it was memory returning to its post.
art: Jarkeld advances in blue armor beneath a hooded helm crowned with subtle fox-ears—an emblem turned into silhouette, so his nickname becomes a warning. His sword is held with measured intent, not bravado, and his cloak trails like a banner that never flutters without purpose.

name: Green Scarab
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has ward {Gs} and can’t be blocked by green creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 as long as there’s a green permanent in play.
flavor: It is believed all Fatima’s scarab gems were gifted to her by her lover, al-Abin.

name: Hallowed Ground
rules:
{1s}{Ws}: Return target nonsnow land you control to its owner’s hand.
{Ws}, Discard a nonsnow land card or sacrifice a nonsnow creature: Draw a card. You gain 1 life.
{Ws}{Ws}{Ws}, Sacrifice Hallowed Ground: Put target nonsnow creature from your graveyard into play under your control.

name: Heal
rules:
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor: “With a single blessing, your gentle hands cradle the fading breath, rekindling hope where darkness, once, seemed sure.”

name: Hipparion
rules: Hipparion can’t be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater unless their controller pays {1s}.
flavor:
“They say Hipparions are to Warriors what Aesthir are to Skyknights. Don’t believe it—these horses are tested on fields where glory is earned, not given.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Justice
rules:
During your upkeep, sacrifice Justice unless you pay {1s}{Ws}.
As Justice enters play, choose a color. Whenever a creature or spell of that color deals damage, Justice deals that much damage to that creature’s or spell’s controller.
flavor: The shadow of fire finds every trespasser.

name: Kelsinko Ranger
rules:
{FirstStrike}`First strike`
{Gs}: Target white creature gains reach until end of turn.
{Ws}: Target green creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: Not as good as the Elvish Rangers, but still highly skilled and versatile.

name: Kjeldoran Elite Guard
rules: {Tn}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. If that creature dies this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Elite Guard. Activate this only during combat.
flavor: Decked with wings for royal ceremonies, their helms gleam for the realm’s glory— but come war’s call, every plume is shed until victory is assured.

name: Kjeldoran Guard
rules: {Tn}: Target creature gets +2/+1 until end of turn. When that creature leaves play this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Guard. Activate this ability only during combat and only if defending player controls no snow lands.
flavor: Always ready for selfless guard duty, unless the snow gets too deep...

name: Kjeldoran Knight
rules:
{FirstStrike}`First strike`  {Vigilance}`Vigilance`                   {Lifelink}`Lifelink`  {ProtectionB}`Protection from black`
{1s}{Ws}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{Ws}{Ws}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. You gain 1 life.
flavor: “Our honor carries the kingdom.”

name: Kjeldoran Phalanx
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {FirstStrike} {Menace}

name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`
{Tn}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
flavor: “With grace, we stand firm—honorable in battle, and generous in death.”

name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {FirstStrike} {Vigilance}

name: Kjeldoran Skyknight
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Flying} {FirstStrike}

name: Kjeldoran Warrior
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2}

name: Lightning Blow
rules:
Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card during the next turn’s upkeep.
flavor:
“If you do it right, they’ll never know what hit them—swift and unstoppable.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Lost Order of Jarkeld
rules:
{Horsemanship}`Horsemanship`  {Indestructible}`Indestructible`
Lost Order of Jarkeld’s power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus either the number of creatures target opponent controls or has in their graveyard, whichever is higher.
flavor: Jarkeld was presumed lost in the Adarkar Wastes—until something returned...

name: Mercenaries
rules:
{Menace}`Menace`  {Ward}`Ward` {2s}
{4s}: The next time Mercenaries would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Any player may activate this ability. When an opponent activates this, you may draw a card.
flavor: Gold buys loyalty in every town.

name: Order of the Sacred Torch
rules:
{Horsemanship}`Horsemanship`
{Tn}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.
{Tn}, Pay 2 life: Counter target red spell.
{Tn}, Pay 3 life: Counter target blue spell.
flavor: “Not all flames are quenched by darkness. Magic falters when my torch burns.”

name: Order of the White Shield
rules:
{Horsemanship}`Horsemanship` {Vigilance}`Vigilance`              {ProtectionB}`Protection from black`
{Ws}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{Ws}{Ws}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: “No shadow can break my shield.”

name: Prismatic Ward
rules:
Enchant creature
As Prismatic Ward enters play, choose a color.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color as well as colorless sources and snow sources.

name: Rally
rules: Blocking creatures get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
“Hold fast, soldiers! This shall be our finest hour! Let the cold winds rage around us as our spirits burn fiercer still. This day will be remembered—this battle will be our glory!”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox,                    famous last words

name: Red Scarab
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has ward {Rs} and can’t be blocked by red creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 as long as there’s a red permanent in play.
flavor: Fatima augmented the scarabs with magical properties in the City of Brass.

name: Sacred Boon
rules: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the next end step, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
flavor:
“Divine gifts are granted only to those who are truly worthy of receiving them.”
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Seraph
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Vigilance}`Vigilance`
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Seraph this turn dies, put that card into play under your control at the next end step. Sacrifice the creature when you lose control of Seraph.
flavor: “No one ever leaves my embrace.”

name: Seraph
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Vigilance}`Vigilance`
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Seraph this turn dies, put that card into play under your control at the next end step. Sacrifice the creature when you lose control of Seraph.
flavor: “Care to guess why no one leaves?”

name: Shield Bearer
rules: {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {BL2} {Vigilance}

name: Snow Hound
rules: {Tn}: Return Snow Hound and target creature you control to their owner’s hand. You gain 3 life.
flavor:
“An Adarkar snow hound will teach you unconditional loyalty. The greatest fear it knows is that you may not come back, that’s why it will always follow you.”
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Swords to Plowshares
rules: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
flavor:
“Lovisa and her so-called Barbarians will not respect us for our military might— they will only respect us for our honor.”
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Warning
rules:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by attacking creatures this turn.
Draw a card at the next end step.
flavor:
“The ever-watchful folk of the Karplusan Mountains are impossible to ambush.”
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: White Scarab
rules:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has ward {Ws} and can’t be blocked by white creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 as long as you control a non-white permanent.
flavor: Whoever dons the White Scarab is said to embrace a spirit free of fear and shame.

name: Adarkar Silver Statues
rules:
Snow creatures you control have protection from planeswalkers and nonsnow legendary creatures, and can’t be made nonsnow.
Whenever a snow creature you control attacks, roll a color die. If defending player controls a land that can produce mana of that color, that creature can’t be blocked.
{4s}, {Tn}: Put a random ability on target creature. This ability can’t be countered.
flavor: They were meant to remind men of gods—but in time, gods learned to fear them instead.
lore: In the age when frost ruled the plains of Adarkar, Aliana’s silver sentinels stood against all who sought dominion over the snowborn. Their mirrored forms reflected not just light, but intention—repelling those of impure purpose and guarding the spirits bound to the cold. To touch one was to feel judgment older than any empire, carved in silence and ice.
art: Ancient effigies loom from the wastes, their polished forms catching thin sunlight that seeps through the clouds. The metal gleams faintly blue, as though the storm itself remembers the spell that forged them, its echo frozen mid-breath across the plain.

name: Aevar Borg, Northern Guide
rules:
{Vigilance}`Vigilance`  {Snowwalk}`Snow landwalk`            {HexproofSnow}`Hexproof from snow`
{Ss}, {Tn}: Prevent all damage dealt this turn from snow or colorless sources.
{1s}{Ss}: Add or remove a counter from target permanent.
{2s}{Ss}, {Tn}: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: “The storm doesn’t blind me; it reminds me where I’ve been.”
lore: Called the Northern Guide, Aevar was less a man than a living memory of the land. His journeys through the wastes revealed not only lost paths but the dangers that slept beneath the fractured ice.
art: Aevar strides across a sunlit expanse, crimson cloak cutting through the white glare. The light crowns him in gold, echoing tales that the thaw itself followed in his wake.

name: Almaaz
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Cs}.
{2s}{Ss}, {Tn}: Search target player’s library for a snow creature and put it into your hand.
{3s}{Ss}{Ss}, {Tn}: Search your library for a snow creature and put it into play.
{Tn}, #Blizzard# — Exile Almaaz until end of turn: Lands you control become snow and have ‘{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Cs}’ during a #Blizzard#.
flavor: The Rigida called this place a crown of ice; and mortals still wear its weight. Even the songs here freeze before they can finish their first note.
lore: Under centuries of frost, Almaaz became more spirit than soil. The Rigida used its buried cities as conduits of control, whispering through the ice to keep mortal life subdued—a land dreaming of warmth yet ruled by memory cold as glass.
art: Frozen valleys carved by centuries of wind, where frost drifts gather in patterns too deliberate to be natural. Light reflects across the ice like runes—silent testimony to powers that command the storms.

name: Altair of Coloni
rules:
+1: You gain 3 life. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control this turn if there are no other planeswalkers in play.
-2: Destroy target creature with power 4 or less. If it attacked or blocked since your last turn, you gain life equal to its toughness.
-7: Return up to two target creatures from any graveyard to play under your control. They gain haste, lifelink and indestructible.
flavor: “I bring light not to blind the wicked, but to remind them what they’ve forgotten.”
lore: A planeswalker of serene conviction, Altair carried the memory of a gentler Dominaria into the Ice Age’s final chapters. His light was said to mend more than flesh; it restored faith in a world that had forgotten the warmth of mercy.
art: Bathed in dawnlight, Altair gazes toward the horizon, staff raised as radiant energy coils around him. The tranquil expression and steady posture evoke a man who commands the storm by understanding its stillness.

name: Argivia
rules:
{Ss}, {Tn}: Add one mana of any color.
{Tn}: Add {Ws}{Us}. Spend this mana only to cast spells that aren’t creatures with power 4 or greater.
If you control at least four different basic lands, Argivia has indestructible.
{2s}, {Tn}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: Where wine once flowed, now wisdom does—and both refine with age.
lore: Argivia stood as Dominaria’s mind through the long frost, its harbor a sanctuary where scholars rebuilt the disciplines of Lat-Nam. Here, invention was tempered by patience: every spark of knowledge tested, every design improved, every foundation laid to withstand both time and tide.
art: The harbor city glows beneath a cold sunset, symbolizing the warmth of knowledge preserved against winter’s reach. The lone observer above the cliffs represents Argivia’s devotion to foresight—watching over a civilization that survives not by strength, but by intellect.

name: Argivian Sylex
rules:
When Argivian Sylex enters play, flip a coin. If you win, gain control of target permanent an opponent controls. Repeat this until you lose the flip.
Opponents can’t cast spells or activate abilities that target you or permanents you control unless they pay {2s} for each spell or ability activation.
flavor: It ended an age—and began one that never forgot.
lore: Born of Thran craft and rediscovered by mortal folly, the Sylex’s detonation scorched the heart of Dominaria into frost. Those who survived came to see it not as a weapon, but as a covenant: a reminder that knowledge without restraint freezes all progress in place.
art: Steam curls from the Sylex’s rim like frozen wind, suggesting the paradox of its nature: warmth that summoned endless cold, beauty that destroyed everything that could admire it.

name: Arkin Egilsson, Skycaptain
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {ProtectionS}`Protection from snow`
If you don’t control a snow land, Arkin gets +1/+0 and has vigilance and haste.
{1s}{Ws}, {Tn}: Roll a D6. Arkin deals that much damage to target creature.
{Tn}, Return Arkin Egilsson to your hand: Exile target creature with flying.
flavor: “Ice covers the land, not the sky. That’s why I made my home there.”
lore: Known as the Skycaptain, Arkin led the last flights of Kjeldoran Aesthir riders when the ice began to break. Refusing to yield to the cold’s dominion, he flew beyond frozen frontiers, turning the storm’s fury against those who would see the thaw reversed.
art: High above the icebound valleys, the Skycaptain’s Aesthir blazes against the morning sun. The composition evokes the balance he upheld—discipline over chaos, light over cold, man and creature joined in purpose.

name: Arna Kennerud, Skyknight
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {FirstStrike}`First strike`  {Vigilance}`Vigilance`   {Lifelink}`Lifelink`  {Ward}`Ward`—Discard a card.
Whenever a modified creature you control attacks, halve #(rounded up)# or double the number of counters on it.
{Ws}{Us}, {Tn}: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
flavor: “The cold took our fields, our rivers, our warmth—but it will never take our sky.”
lore: During the height of the Ice Age, Arna Kennerüd commanded Kjeldor’s elite Skyknights, fliers who carried messages, hope, and flame across frozen dominions. Her tactics transformed aerial warfare—each strike perfectly measured between courage and restraint. She was famed for rallying troops through sheer presence, her Aesthir’s shadow a promise of survival rather than fear.
art: Bathed in dawnlight, Arna and her Aesthir climb into open sky, the glow beneath them echoing the promise of the Thaw. The interplay of light and motion conveys both command and mercy—qualities that defined her legend.

name: Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`
During your upkeep, if you control an animal creature, draw a card.
When you cast a creature spell, it enters play with +1/+1 counter and gains flying.
{1s}, {Tn}: Tap or untap target creature with flying. If it’s snow, you may scry 3.
flavor: “Air moves where it wishes. I merely ask it to take me along.”
lore: Arnjlot’s mastery of flight was only part of his legend; what set him apart was how he used it. He stitched messages between isolated strongholds, directed beasts through blinding blizzards, and carved safe paths through the air when the land itself was impassable.
art: Arnjlot rises between swirling clouds and a blazing sun, suspended by currents that bend to his calm command. The balanced light around him mirrors the harmony he taught—magic as uplift, not domination.

name: Ashes Beneath the Ice
rules:
As Ashes Beneath the Ice enters play, name a card. Mill cards from the top of your library until you mill the named card.
If your library runs out of cards, you may draw from an opponent’s library and play black creature cards from their graveyard.
flavor: The cold preserves many things. Regret is the least of them.
lore: Legends tell of forgotten cairns swallowed by blizzards, where the remnants of the fallen lingered in crystalline suspension. To speak a name at such a site was to invite the frost to sift through ages of silence and restore what the world had tried to hide.
art: Under a moon ringed with frostlight, cracked burial stones jut from the snow like stubborn memories. The untouched drifts around them capture the sense that something waits beneath—listening only for a name strong enough to stir it.

name: Avram Garrisson
rules:
{Horsemanship}`Horsemanship`  {ProtectionW}`Protection from white`
Black creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain first strike and protection from red.
{Bs}, {Tn}: Counter target white or red spell.
If Avram Garrisson dies, return it to play as a Zombie Knight with haste. While Avram is a Zombie, you may play Zombie cards from any graveyard, and during your upkeep, pay {Bs} or exile Avram Garrisson.
flavor: “I rode for the crown once. Then I learned the crown needed a firmer hand.”
lore: In his prime, Avram was Kjeldor’s unofficial warlord, admired for strength yet feared for ambition. His disdain for the crown and hatred for the Balduvians drew him toward darker counsel until he pledged himself to Lim-Dûl. There he found new purpose in ruthless certainty, commanding shadow-clad knights and carving through foes untouched by holy magic or flame. When he finally fell, the necromancer simply raised him again, forging Avram into a mounted terror whose loyalty could no longer falter—only hunger for more conquest.
art: Avram charges across a frozen ridge, armor dull beneath the stormlight, mirroring the grim reputation he earned as Kjeldor’s most unyielding commander. The spectral haze curling from his steed hints at Lim-Dûl’s claim upon him—power that preserved his dominance even beyond death.

name: Azoria
rules:
{Tn}, Pay 1 life: Add {Cs}, {Us}, {Bs}, or {Rs}.
As Azoria enters play, destroy all creatures.
All basic lands are Deserts that produce {Cs} instead of any other type of mana.
{8s}, {Tn}: Destroy Azoria. Any player may activate this ability. If they do, Azoria’s owner has an infinite amount of {Bs} mana for as long as Azoria is in their graveyard.
flavor: A plane unpeopled, yet never empty of consequences.
lore: Azoria once drifted quietly within the Shard of the Twelve Worlds—a wilderness of open sea and barren, wind-cut islands. When Freyalise and Tevesh Szat carried their feud across its waters, their struggle shattered the archipelagos and slew every creature that depended on them. What remained was a world scoured clean, a perfect conduit for the dark strength Szat claimed in the aftermath.
art: Vast waters lap against jagged peaks that once formed a scattered archipelago. The quiet beauty belies the ruin beneath—collapsed seabeds and extinguished ecosystems. The stillness of the distant sky hints at a plane long stripped of its voice, preserved now only as the memory of a battleground.

name: Balduvian Steppe
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Rs}.
{Rs}{Rs}{Rs}, {Tn}: Target opponent searches your library for a red permanent and puts it into play under your control.
{Tn}, #Blizzard# — Exile Balduvian Steppe until end of turn: Mountains you control are snow until end of turn.
flavor: The Steppe grows wheat, legends, and trouble—though never in the order anyone expects.
lore: The Balduvian Steppe began as harsh tundra flanking the Karplusan foothills, shaped by migrations, raids, and clan rivalries during the Age of Ice. As the climate warmed, the plains bloomed into one of Terisiare’s richest food-growing regions, drawing settlers who repurposed old tribal trails into fields. When the Flooding consumed its southwest, the Steppe shifted once more, becoming a peninsula marked by both survival and change.
art: The horizon burns gold where day meets frost, reflecting a place that endured more winters than any tribe could count. Its quiet vastness suggests a region shaped by endurance, warmed only by those stubborn enough to call it home.

name: Balesh Pass
rules:
Balesh Pass enters play tapped if you control a Goblin, Orc, or Human creature.
{Tn}: Add {Rs} or {Ws}.
Snow lands you control are 1/4 Wall creatures with defender. They’re still lands.
{1s}{Ws}, Sacrifice Balesh Pass: Return target Knight from a graveyard to play under your control. It gains menace and haste.
flavor: Where the winds clash hardest, so do the people who trust them.
lore: Nestled between Mount Kireshal and Mount Delapre, the Pass remained snowbound long after nearby regions thawed, preserving centuries of conflict in ice and echo. Its narrow ledges witnessed shifting fortunes—pikemen halting an orcish charge in one era, only for goblin-assisted flanking to turn the tide in another. Though the political lines have faded, the Pass still stands as a frozen ledger of victories, losses, and unlikely truces.
art: The narrow sweep of white terrain stretches between jagged faces of stone, a corridor shaped by time, cold, and too many desperate retreats. The quiet descent of the traveler mirrors the solemn weight carried by all who survived the conflicts etched into this mountain path.

name: Bandu
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Rs}.
{Rs}{Rs}{Rs}, {Tn}: Target opponent searches your library for a red permanent and puts it into play under your control.
{Tn}, #Blizzard# — Exile Bandu until end of turn: Mountains you control become snow and deal 1 damage to any target when tapped for mana during a #Blizzard#.
flavor: The canyon never echoes the same shout twice—mostly because the shouters rarely make it back.
lore: For the Balduvian clans, Bandu served as both border and proving ground; young warriors navigated its ledges to test courage long before blades ever touched. The terrain hid predators and ambushers alike, becoming a favored battleground for settling disputes out of sight of the open plains. Stories say the cliffs still remember the footsteps of those who earned their names among them.
art: The sweeping chasm reveals layer upon layer of crimson stone, each stratum hinting at ages of pressure and upheaval beneath Balduvia’s frozen crust. The winding river of light below suggests a path carved by perseverance rather than mercy.

name: Belenda Danisdotter
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Vigilance}`Vigilance`
When Belenda enters play, destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
When Belenda dies, if Jaya is in play, exile Belenda. Otherwise, return her to play as a Zombie Knight. She gains first strike, lifelink, and haste. Put a +1/+1 counter on her for each time she died.
flavor: “I once believed duty made you strong. Turns out clarity does, and you usually find it on the way down.”
lore: Belenda began as a loyal Kjeldoran skyknight, known for her discipline and her friendship with Jaya Ballard, whom she trusted even when their missions grew questionable. Years later, she fell under the influence of Márton Stromgald and his rhetoric of Kjeldoran supremacy, a path that led her to Tresserhorn and ultimately to betrayal. There she was slain and raised by Lim-Dûl as an undead skyknight, only to find release when Jaya ended her corrupted existence.
art: Her crimson scarf flashes against the cold wind, a reminder of the warmth and friendships she carried before darker voices found her. The Aesthir’s sweeping wings carve through the air with the certainty she once held in her cause.

name: Big Bog Frog
rules:
{Deathtouch}`Deathtouch`  {ProtectionR}`Protection from red`   {Toxic}`Toxic 3`  {Swampwalk}`Swampwalk`
#Landfall# — Whenever a Swamp enters play, put a +1/+1 counter on Big Bog Frog. If it’s a Snow Swamp, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.
{1s}{Bs}, {Tn}: Exile target nonblack creature until Big Bog Frog leaves play.
flavor: Step close. The swamp has been waiting for someone exactly your size.
lore: Before the catastrophe, the Big Bog Frog was a curious oddity shown off by Peter Langwynd to visitors brave enough to trek through the Kron Lu delta. Vram’s attempt to harness its strength cracked the region’s mana lattice, turning the marsh into a wasteland overnight. The frog endured by mutating into a mana-scarred horror, now the final sentinel of a place abandoned by both life and its creators.
art: Perched under a swollen moon, the frog’s bulk suggests a creature that outgrew its ecosystem long after the ecosystem died. The withered trees and stagnant pools around it echo the quiet finality of a marsh that no longer remembers softness.

name: Black Pearl of Nadrum
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Cs}{Cs}{Cs}{Cs}.  Spend this mana only to cast instant, sorcery, and enchantment spells.
Instant, sorcery, and enchantment spells you cast cost {1s} less to cast.
Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, Black Pearl deals 1 damage to them.
{2s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Black Pearl: Choose one — Deal 5 damage to any target; or gain 10 life.
flavor: Power this volatile doesn’t corrupt; it simply asks if you’re bold enough to hold on.
lore: Once part of Og’s enchanted ring, the Black Pearl of Nadrum warped every spell it touched, magnifying power while twisting intention. Riolla, the Mercanto Schreefa, stole it and traded its volatile strength for the freedom Og denied her. The artifact has changed hands many times since, each owner discovering that its gifts come paired with sharp, unforgettable pain.
art: Set against a vast, pale horizon, the Pearl looks too small to hold such volatile might, its glassy surface quivering with restrained resonance. Even untouched, it seems to draw breath from the cold air around it, preparing to magnify whatever force reaches for it next.

name: Boreal Tundra
flavor: Where warmth dares to wander, the tundra simply outlives it.
lore: Though nearly lifeless, the Boreal still sheltered scattered elves, goblins, and centaurs who adapted to the numbing air through generations of exposure to Rimewind influence. They lived in the long shadow of Tresserhorn, struggling against cold that grew sharper each year as the cult deepened its spells. After the glaciers retreated, the land vanished under the expanding waters, leaving no trace of its strange inhabitants.
art: The jagged ice and pale reflections make the tundra seem suspended in time, untouched by anything except the tightening grip of Rimewind spells. The vast, empty expanse conveys a land that expected no witness to its final silence.

name: Caves of Neffia
rules:
Caves of Neffia enters play tapped unless you control a snow permanent.
{Tn}: Add {Gs} or {Us}.
Creatures you control have ‘{Tn}: Prevent 1 damage to any target.’
{Tn}: Target creature gains hexproof until end of turn. Gain X life, then scry X where X equals a d6 roll.
flavor: The caves shelter anyone willing to enter—though they rarely shelter them from themselves.
lore: The Caves of Neffia formed around an underground oasis that sustained the Neffian people through years of hardship before their forced removal to Sumifa. Since then, the caves have become a vital resting point along the harsh route from Sumifa to the Borderlands. Countless travelers—from Ogwater Rifkin to Riolla Hifrata—have trusted its water and shadows before crossing Almaaz’s unforgiving terrain.
art: Dense vegetation clings to stone shelves where the underground spring nurtured life otherwise impossible in Almaaz’s dry reaches. The interplay of shadow and mist implies a place that protects without promising comfort.

name: Chaeska the Towerwright
rules:
Zombies, Skeletons, and Horrors you control get +1/+1 and gain deathtouch, protection from red, and ward {Bs}.
Whenever Chaeska attacks and isn’t blocked, it deals no combat damage and defending player loses 4 life. When Chaeska gets blocked, it gets +2/+0 for each creature blocking it.
flavor: “Strike me down if you wish. I have rebuilt worse than myself.”
lore: Chaeska predates Lim-Dûl by two millennia. He raised Tresserhorn atop the ruined Conclave of Mages, serving as its castellan throughout the Ice Age. As Lim-Dûl’s might grew, Chaeska became his strongest undead general and defended the fortress against Jodah and Jaya Ballard, though the pair managed to maim and banish him. After Lim-Dûl’s defeat, Chaeska built the undead Lord of Tresserhorn in mourning, only to lose both his creation and his keep before the forces of New Argive reduced the citadel to ruin.
art: The crimson glow reflecting from his axe mirrors the red wards he once wore against Jaya’s fire, a reminder of battles fought in frozen valleys. The darkness around him suggests the cold halls of Tresserhorn where he waited centuries for orders.

name: Cheyne the Archaeologist
rules:
{Reach}`Reach`  {ProtectionB}`Protection from black`
When Cheyne enters play, reveal the top three cards of your library. If one of them is an artifact or land card, draw all three.
{Rs}: Cheyne deals 1 damage to any target.
Whenever Cheyne deals damage to a player, you may scry 1.
flavor: “Ruins don’t scare me. It’s the answers that usually do.”
lore: Cheyne’s artistry and sharp eye earned him a place in the rediscovery of Sumifa, where his sketches helped unearth forgotten chambers and relics linked to his mysterious past. His secret journey with Ogwater Rifkin, Claria, and others carried him through kingdoms and dangers well beyond Almaaz. In the end, he learned that heritage mattered less than the choices he made, from saving his companions to helping heal Javin’s near-fatal wound.
art: The warm desert sun glows behind Cheyne as he studies his notes, capturing the quiet determination of someone who has chased answers across continents. The abandoned dwellings around him echo the forgotten histories he works to uncover.

name: Chromium Rhuell
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Trample}`Trample`
If Tevesh Szat is in play, sacrifice Rhuell.
{Ws}{Us}: Rhuell becomes a 1/1 Human with hexproof until end of turn. Draw a card.
{Tn}: Until end of turn, target Human or planeswalker gains hexproof and redirect all damage dealt to it to Rhuell.
flavor: “Shapeshifting is easy. Integrity is the real magic.”
lore: While the great powers clashed across a frozen Dominaria, Chromium moved among humans as one of them, using his shapeshifting to shield villages and observe the changing world firsthand. His refusal to serve Szat or Leshrac made him a target, ultimately drawing him into the ill-fated Summit. There Szat slew him, believing the death of an Elder Dragon would fuel escape from the Shard as the world shifted into the Thaw.
art: The pale light catches on Chromium’s metallic scales, evoking both the purity of the northern snows and the clarity of his long-held convictions. His poised wings and watchful posture hint at centuries spent observing humans from behind borrowed faces.

name: Claria the Cartographer
rules:
{Vigilance}`Vigilance`  {Haste}`Haste`  {Ward}`Ward` {3s}
Whenever a creature with a counter on it deals damage to a player, draw a card.
{Tn}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
You may play an additional land each turn. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
flavor: “Most roads are straight until you add people.”
lore: Claria’s life shifted from cartography in Sumifa to survival across deserts, orc lands, selkie waterways, and elven borders when she joined Cheyne’s search for answers. Her capture at the Chimes tested her resolve, but her inherited songs proved crucial to Ogwater’s banishment of the Beast. By journey’s end, she and Cheyne discovered that their paths had been converging long before either noticed.
art: Claria leans over her map with practiced grace, the warm desert light catching the gold in her eyes as if reflecting the horizons she charts. The distant mountains behind her echo the journeys that reshaped both her craft and her fate.

name: Curse of Stromgald
rules:
Whenever you cast a black spell, target player discards a card.
{3s}{Bs}{Bs}: Target player discards their hand. Activate only as a sorcery.
flavor: Stromgald’s undead warriors were forged in betrayal and necromancy, and cursed with inability to retain any knowledge.
lore: Stromgald knights once swore an oath under a phoenix crest, and Lim-Dûl corrupted that oath into a parasitic enchantment that punished independent thought. Every surge of black mana reignited the “burning” of the oath, scorching memories from both the knight and their foes, as though ideals were being incinerated from the inside out. When invoked deliberately, the curse could consume every remembered thing a person had ever held.
art: The knights advance through snow and cinder, their capes snapping like torn banners of a cause long lost to memory. The looming fortress reflects the curse that binds them—endless loyalty without understanding.

name: Damon, Wizard before Time
rules:
Damon gets +0/+2 and Ward {Ws}{Us} as long as you control another Wizard.
{Tn}: Exile target permanent cast last turn.
{Tn}: Until end of turn, exchange control of target permanent an opponent controls and target permanent you control.
{Xs}: Redirect X damage dealt to Damon to any other target.
flavor: “If you don’t like how today is going, don’t worry—yesterday still owes me a favor.”
lore: Damon survived the Thaw by mastering the same trick that saved his life as an apprentice: turning illusions and misplaced intent against those who meant him harm. His encounter with the Mirror of Yesterday left him with an uncanny ability to pull truth from a moment just passed, bending outcomes as though they had never settled. Other wizards recognize this gift instinctively, for Damon’s magic grows sharper and safer when anchored to another disciplined mind.
art: The circular time spell in front of Damon glows with the cold radiance of the School of the Unseen’s most dangerous teachings, echoing the Mirror of Yesterday’s impossible reflections. Snow curls at his feet but refuses to settle on him, as though even the weather hesitates to choose which version of him to obey.

name: Davin Lansson, Naturalist
rules:
Davin has landwalk of each land type you control and protection from each color of permanents you control.
During your upkeep, if you control three or more creatures, draw a card.
{Gs}{Gs}{Us}, {Tn}: Name a creature card and its mana cost. Search your library for that card and put it into play if you guessed its mana cost correctly. Otherwise, exile it.
flavor: “Nature doesn’t hide its secrets. People just walk too loudly to hear them.”
lore: Davin served as naturalist on Disa’s expeditions, cataloging beasts that had resurfaced with the warming world. His uncanny instinct for reading terrain and creature behavior allowed him to predict threats long before they struck, moving through forests, tundra, and river valleys as if each welcomed him. That attunement eventually grew so profound that the environment itself seemed to shelter him, and his companions claimed he could summon the exact ally needed simply by knowing its place in the natural order.
art: A cold glow washes over the slopes while Davin stands attentive, reading the land’s quiet signs. Nothing stirs, yet the scene feels poised—ready for the creature he already knows is near.

name: Disa the Restless
rules:
{Vigilance}`Vigilance`  {ProtectionS}`Protection from snow`
Legendary creatures cost {1s} less to cast.
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
{Tn}: Target Human, Elf, or Wall creature can’t be blocked this turn.
Whenever Disa the Restless attacks, you may draw a basic land card.
flavor: “If a path looks impassable, that simply means no one has tried it yet.”
lore: Disa spent the Ice Age pushing past the borders of Kjeldor, recording the Adarkar Wastes, the Yavimaya River, and even the immense ice walls that defied every explorer before her. Her relentless pace and uncanny awareness kept her ahead of beasts, undead, and storms alike, allowing those who traveled with her to move swiftly and safely. Companions swore that under her leadership legends seemed to find their footing more easily, and that when she charged into danger, the land itself revealed the routes and resources needed to survive.
art: She stands poised in the snow, armor tracing the strength and grace of her figure, the kind of beauty born from survival rather than vanity. Even the bleak tundra seems to steady itself under her gaze.

name: Disa's Journal
rules:
During your upkeep, if you control at least three different lands, draw a card.
Whenever an opponent’s creature attacks you, you may pay {1s}. If you do, prevent all combat damage it would deal this turn and put a tame counter on it. As long as a creature has a tame counter, it can’t attack you.
flavor:
“When the world turns silent and you feel small against the ice, write. The page will steady you long before courage returns.”
—Disa the Restless
lore: Across the Adarkar Wastes and the Yavimaya frontier, Disa wrote tirelessly to capture how the land shaped both friend and foe. Her journal became a field guide to surviving ambushes, revealing when to stand firm and when to slip aside. Readers found themselves drawing clarity from its pages each dawn, as though her experience sharpened their own instincts.
art: In the dim morning light, the journal shimmers with the quiet authority of hard-won wisdom. Outside, frozen plains glint like a mirror to Disa’s long journeys. The scene carries both guidance and the solitude that shaped it.

name: Drufalden, Last of Rigida
rules:
{Flying}`Flying`  {Snowwalk}`Snow landwalk`
When Drufalden enters play, sacrifice two creatures, then exile target creature.
Whenever a creature you control dies, exile the top card of an opponent’s library. You may play that card until end of next turn.
{2s}: Return a nonsnow land an opponent played this turn to their hand.
flavor: “Warmth is a story mortals tell themselves to feel safe. I prefer truths that do not melt when questioned.”
lore: In the Ice Age’s later centuries, Drufalden froze entire valleys to hold her queendom together, her will so absolute that the death of any under her rule echoed back to her as power. She banished rivals without hesitation, trapping their spirits in ice or casting them into oblivion, and her followers feared her enough to remain loyal even as they dwindled. Stories claim she could seize the destiny of those who perished near her, twisting their futures into tools for her own designs.
art: The wind parts for her, revealing a figure carved in glacial elegance, her presence as commanding as the mountains behind her. She moves with an effortless, icy confidence, like a woman who has never once doubted her dominion over winter.

name: Elkan, Balduvian Mage
rules:
{Haste}`Haste`  {ProtectionW}`Protection from white`
Warriors, Orcs, and Goblins you control get +1/+0, gain haste, and must attack each combat if able.
{Tn}: Elkan deals 2 damage to any target.
When Elkan is dealt combat damage by an Orc, sacrifice Elkan.
flavor: “Balduvian fire burns brightest when someone else is standing closer to the explosion.”
lore: Before his fatal miscalculation at Balesh Pass, Elkan built a reputation for turning disorder into advantage, urging Balduvian fighters into furious assaults that left opponents no time to regroup. His firecraft echoed that volatility—quick, sharp bursts of destructive magic delivered with no regard for subtlety. But Elkan’s arrogance blinded him to how deeply his manipulation had soured the orcs under him, and their violent retribution became the last tactical outcome he never planned for.
art: Elkan stands high above the valley, flame lifting against a sky bruised by stormlight. The cold around him seems to recoil, bending to the confidence of a mage who believes every battlefield belongs to him.

name: Embereck, Ash Warlord
rules:
+1: Embereck deals 2 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
-2: Sacrifice a creature. Embereck deals damage equal to the number of Mountains in play to each opponent or each creature they control.
-8: Target opponent sacrifices a land, a creature, an artifact and a planeswalker, then Embereck deals 4 damage to that opponent.
flavor: “Burn a creature, burn a city, burn a world—it's all the same gesture, just scaled.”
lore: As civilization crawled back from the long winter, Embereck regarded the rebuilding efforts with a kind of fiery impatience, believing weakness had taken root during the cold centuries. His battle with Ravidel over the Golgothian Sylex proved how far he was willing to go—wielding power fueled by sacrifice and the raw fury of Dominaria’s peaks. Wherever he walked, the landscape bore his mark: scorched earth, shattered wards, and enemies left with nothing but a single choice—submit, or burn.
art: Ash drifts from his steps, glowing faintly before the wind claims it. Embereck looms against a sky bruised with stormlight, a figure shaped by volcanic wrath rather than mortal flesh.

name: Endless Sea
flavor: Travelers swear the horizon curves away from them here, as if the sea itself prefers to remain uncharted.
lore: Before Terisiare shattered into isles, the Endless Sea stretched from Ronom Glacier to the battered cliffs of Gulmany, its waters growing darker as the long winter settled in. Over the centuries of frost, rot and salt intertwined below the ice floes, leaving pockets of shadowed water where strange life endured. This lingering mix of purity and corruption is why mages say the sea answers to both tide and grave.
art: A silent current threads between slabs of ancient frost, tinting the cobalt water with hints of the mysteries hidden below. The horizon blurs, giving the impression the world simply ends where the ice begins.

name: Eyebeams Cat
rules:
{DoubleStrike}`Double strike`  {Infect}`Infect`                   {HexproofR}`Hexproof from red`
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Eyebeams Cat this turn dies, its controller gets a poison counter.
{Bs}: Eyebeams Cat gains indestructible until end of turn.
flavor: The moon rises, the eyes glow, and death follows. The pattern is remarkably consistent.
lore: Some scholars argue the Eyebeams Cat emerged during the Ice Age when corrupted mana seeped into the bones of ordinary strays scavenging battlefield ruins. Whatever its origin, it learned quickly that death follows wherever it looks, its victims dissolving into blight that spreads like a rumor in winter wind. Its ability to evade flames and refuse final death stoked tales of an immortal predator stalking the snowbound frontier.
art: The cat sits poised on a frost-bitten stone, its eyes burning like embers stolen from a dying star. Snow drifts around it, yet the shadows at its paws feel deeper than winter should allow.

name: Faralyn of the Shard
rules:
+2: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
-4: Target opponent sacrifices a legendary permanent. If they don’t control a legendary permanent, you draw three cards instead.
-7: Gain control of up to three target creatures. They become black Horrors in addition to their other creature types and colors.
flavor: “Power isn’t taken. It’s invited—usually by someone too foolish to know better.”
lore: Faralyn spent the Ice Age trapped within the Shard of Twelve Worlds, studying its frozen boundaries alongside Freyalise while quietly pursuing plans of his own. He had already transformed Vaevictis Asmadi and broken Ravidel to his service—proof that identity itself was clay in his hands. Those same manipulations echo in his magic now: stripping legends of their purpose, bending minds to horror, and drawing power from whatever must fall to keep him free.
art: The planeswalker’s eyes narrow against the drifting snow, the orb he wields pulsing like a captive star. His stance suggests quiet command, as if even the storm awaits instruction.

name: Fatima, Mysterious Benefactor
rules:
+1: Put a brass counter on target permanent. As long as a permanent has a brass counter on it, it’s an artifact in addition to its other types.
-2: Until your next turn, whenever a source would deal damage to you or a creature you control, it deals that much damage to its controller instead.
-8: Target nonbasic land gains “{T}: Add X mana of any color where X equals the number of artifacts in play.” Exile all other lands.
flavor: “Grief is a fine metal to work with; it bends only for the one who forged it.”
lore: Fatima’s visit to Terisiare was so fleeting that only her gifts remained: five scarab necklaces left with those she deemed worthy, each humming with Rabian brasswork even in the killing cold. These relics embodied her peculiar magic—turning the mundane into metal, twisting damage against its owner, and warping the land when too many of her creations gathered in one place. By the time the amulets’ secrets were understood, Fatima had already planeswalked back to Rabiah, leaving only rumors of a warm figure against the endless frost.
art: Fatima rises against the cold landscape with an elegance at odds with the harsh air, her posture relaxed yet undeniably commanding. The soft glow around her frames the strength in her features—beauty shaped by age, will, and long mastery of grief-forged magic. Even in this frozen world, she looks like someone the storm itself would hesitate to cross.

name: Fens of Foulmere
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Bs}{Gs}. Fens of Foulmere deals 1 damage to you.
Whenever you tap Fens of Foulmere for mana, put a –1/–1 counter on target creature.
{Bs}, {Tn}: Each opponent gets a poison counter.
{4s}, {Tn}, Sacrifice this land: Destroy all lands. Each player loses life equal to the number of lands they’ve had destroyed this way.
flavor: This place remembers every trespasser. It just takes its time collecting the debt.
lore: The Foulmere was once a living marsh at the mouth of the Kron Lu River, home to the Eub Hlut gnomes and the hermit-naturalist Peter Langwynd. That life ended when the planeswalker Vram drained the bog’s mana during a duel, scorching the wetlands into a black husk crawling with undead. Its mire still reacts violently to intrusion—bleeding poison into those who tap its strength, and lashing back with death whenever its rotting soil is disturbed.
art: Moonlight glints across slick pools where reeds bend under their own weight, as though the marsh has bled the vigor from them. The fens stretch outward like a half-living bruise on the land, quiet yet heavy with the sense that something watches beneath the surface.

name: Finroy the False Regent
rules:
{Vigilance}`Vigilance`  {Horsemanship}`Horsemanship`
Finroy enters play tapped and doesn’t untap during your next untap step.
Finroy has indestructible during combat.
Whenever another creature you control would leave play, you may sacrifice Finroy the False Regent instead.
flavor: “I learned that heroism is mostly posture… and that shining armor hides bruises beautifully.”
lore: Finroy’s years impersonating Lord Rothchild in Jornstad taught him the slow ache of armor worn too long and the panic of facing dangers meant for someone else. Whether staggering from Sir Udo’s lance or dragging himself from Rhindle’s path, he somehow remained standing while those around him leaned on his resolve.
art: Snow drifts through the narrow streets of Jornstad as Finroy rides beneath lantern-light, the weight of borrowed armor settling across his shoulders. His poise is steady despite the cold, a quiet echo of the courage he never asked to display.

name: Flarg Mountains
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Rs}. If you spend this mana to cast a Goblin, that spell can’t be countered. Roll a `d6` and put that many +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever you tap Flarg Mountains for mana, target creature can’t block this turn.
{2s}{Rs}, {Tn}, Sacrifice Flarg Mountains: It deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
{1s}{Rs}{Rs}, {Tn}: Draw a card.
flavor: Goblins say the mountains speak. Scholars disagree—yet no one denies the way they shimmer when the peaks begin to glow.
lore: Once a frontier of the Malpiri Plains, the Flarg hardened into a goblin refuge as the Ice Age spread and raids dwindled. Deep within, fire-lit caverns and unstable slopes fostered a people who treated danger as opportunity, and opportunity as spectacle. Their tricks grew bolder through the Thaw, until a single game-turned-war wiped them out and left the peaks simmering with the echo of their chaos.
art: Wind scours the high passes, carrying the faint, sharp scent of heated rock. Light breaks across the crags in sudden bursts, hinting at the unruly energy that defined the goblins who lived here.

name: Fortress of Tresserhorn
rules:
{Tn}: Add {Bs}{Bs} or {Rs}{Rs}. You lose 1 life.
Whenever you cast a black spell, you may mill 2. If a creature card is milled this way, return it to your hand, then discard a card.
{Tn}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses life equal to sacrificed creature’s power.
{5s}, Sacrifice this land: Destroy all creatures except Zombies, Skeletons, and Knights.
flavor:
“Death keeps its ledger well at Tresserhorn. Only the debtors ever walk out.”
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn
lore: Raised by Chaeska over the ruins of the Conclave of Mages, Tresserhorn became Lim-Dûl’s stronghold as the Ice Age deepened. The pit beneath it fed his necromancy, drawing souls upward like a cold tide, and the keep’s halls grew crowded with ever-returning dead. Stromgald knights, mages, and revenants alike found themselves reclaimed by its sorcery, each sacrifice tightening the grip of the Lord who ruled from the bone-carved throne.
art: Tresserhorn’s spire cuts sharply into the winter haze, its stones slick with frost and splinters of old magic. A dim radiance leaks from its depth, hinting at the countless lives bound within its walls.

name: Freyalise the Fire Mage
rules:
{FirstStrike}`First strike`  {Ward}`Ward` {1s}{Ss}
